reviews.review: Beautiful Canal Area. The Herengracht Canal is one of the prettiest canal areas in Amsterdam. We stayed at the Banks Mansion Hotel which has canal view rooms overlooking the Herengracht. Banks Mansion is a very nice hotel in a very nice pretty area of Amsterdam. A stroll or canal boat ride along the Herengracht is a must if you visit Amsterdam.
Awe...some buildings. The architecture in this area is great. Walk or cruise along taking note of the facades of these buildings. It's awesome. I've never seen anything like it.
Beautiful Canala. Along with the rest of the Amsterdam canals, it is worth visiting Herengracht. It is a beautiful canal that represents the traditional Dutch architecture.

Good walking street to get across part of the city. Stayed just a block off Herengracht for 8 days, and found it to be relatively quiet in most areas. Allowed us to circumnavigate the busy streets when we wanted to just walk, and look at houses.

Picturesque Amsterdam Canal. I have always enjoyed the views afforded by the bridges over the Herengracht. So typical with boats moored on the sides, trees on the banks and a canal boat treading the water.

Gentleman's Canal. The Herengracht is considered the most important canal in the city. In the 17th century, the richest and most influential people of the city lived on this canal. Even today, an address on the Herengracht is seen as prestigious. There are several hundred heritage sites located on this canal, including beautiful homes and at least 5 different museums.
Stunning. Well, what can you say about a leafy lazy canal on a sunny day. With the most beautiful houses on show, a lovely walk with much to see..Just listen out for bike bells lol!

lovely place to visit, quaint buildings all on a canal. We stayed on the Herengracht at The Hoxton Hotel. Great central place to stay when visiting Amsterdam. Everything within a decent walk. A great experience.
Beautiful stretch of canal. Very picturesque canal with lots of fantastic (slightly wobbly!) buildings. It is very plesant to sit out with a coffee and watch the boats go by.
lovely street. our B and B was located on this street. Loved walking up and down this canal street. Many beautiful homes along the street.
Great canal boat tour.. Took a canal boat tour on a smaller boat ......just 8 of us. Very informative guide knew the answer to all our questions. Most impressive.

Lovely walk. Herengracht is one of the three big old canals of Amsterdam. They're all just beautiful to walk along. Herengracht is a little different from the others because it doesn't have many shops or restaurants along it, just beautiful houses,giving it a more peaceful atmosphere. Definitely allow time for a walk along this lovely canal.
Wonderful. The canals are amazing in Amsterdam, just rent a bike and cycle to get lost. The best way to visit in a different way.
A must see. There is the possibility of taking a beautiful boat trip and admiring the sumptuous houses around it.

weekend trip to Amsterdam. we done a boat trip round some of the canals it is a very good experience to see all the different types of town houses and boats well worth the visit there is a lot of history associated with the canals,
Beautiful canal. There are many canals and most of them you would think look the same , but this canal definitely has more to offer with more restaurants and cafes !

Lucrative canal. There are some canals in Amsterdam, this one is the lucrative one. There are many restaurants, boats, shops around the canal. One can have houseboat also. One can use boat or bicycle or can have a walk around. It is around 1-2 km away from the central station.

Authentic Amsterdam. The canals, the boats, the shops, the bridges, the houses and smalls shops makes this a wonderful location in the heart of amsterdam. This is something not to miss. Grab a boat, a bike or just take a walk. You'll be amazed!

Our favourite Canal. Ok we used to live here over 10 years ago (289), but we went back recently and it's still one of my favourite canals. It's called the Gentleman's Canal and was once considered as the most important canal in the city. It's where the wealthier merchants lived. It also happens to be one of the most interesting canals to walk along. It has Amsterdam's oldest house on it (No.81) 364-370 you find the four Cromhout houses. And further down are the Seven bridges of Reguliersgracht. One of the most photographed sights in the city and very beautiful. We enjoyed a morning stroll to De Herengracht cafe (435) for in our opinion one of the best breakfasts in Amsterdam. Coming back in September of this year, we noticed a few shops and cafe's had gone or changed but it's still one of the best looking canals in the city as far as we are concerned. And definitely worth a stroll down.
Canal trip. We took two canal trips on our stay and this was one of the canals we travelled down. Pretty area lots of houseboats .

Night and Day - a Delight. We love strolling down this gracious canal at any time of the day or night...so peaceful and lovely. And how generous the residents are to let us peek inside their gorgeous homes in the evening, as we wander by the twinkly-lit bridges.
Typical canal in Amsterdam. Crowded like all of Amsterdam, dirty water and sidewalks filled with trash and dog excrement. Safer to view from a canal boat ride.
Great walking canal. We enjoyed several strolls along this canal. Our hotel was locked in the area so it made it perfect for us.
fascinating canal. Great to sail down and even more so to sit at a cafe along it and have herring with onions, accompanied by a great Dutch beer

Charming and crowd free. Beautiful canal lined with hotels, houses and restaurants. Quiet, safe and charming. Many restaurants from fancy to small, neighborhood cafes. Sidewalks are very narrow and bike traffic is heavy, although confined to the bike lanes, which are easy to mistake for sidewalks--beware!

Picture postcard of Amsterdam. This is what you think of when you hear about the city of Amsterdam. Beautiful canals, house boats, cafes, and historic building. A great "canal ring" to see from a boat and to walk around and enjoy a cup of coffee.

love this place. love this place cannot wait to go back, so beautiful and peaceful we had a great time, the Ann Franc museum is a must to see and hear what they went though just made it so real and so moving an experience
Great Street!. Of all those beautiful streets in Amsterdam, this is one of the best. Well worth the visit. The homes are incredible and the canal is outstanding.
Typical Amsterdam. The Herengracht is nice to visit if you want to see the typical 'Amsterdamse Grachten' and Amsterdam architecture. Usually very busy, like the rest of Amsterdam.
Great views. Just a 5 minute walk away from the busy Dam Square this canal ring is great for seeing the canals at their best , great coffeeshop there called Amnesia

Great Service and food. We ate on two consecutive evenings at this friendly bar. We had tables by the canal. It was busy but the staff are super friendly and welcoming and create a great atmosphere. Originally planned to stop just for drinks but the food around us looked so good we stayed to eat. Delicious, perfectly cooked Dorado fish with crispy muscles and peas was the favourite but excellent burgers too.

A Room with a View of the Herengracht from Our Hotel. The Herengracht is one of a series of parallel canals forming part of a ring of waterways that are characteristic of Amsterdam. The buildings fronting the Herengracht are mostly respectful of the architectural style that evolved as housing for Amsterdam's citizenry. The Herengracht exudes authenticity and a sense of the benefit of protections for the structural and developmental heritage in which Amsterdam takes great pride.

Beautiful. Lovely and typically Amsterdam. There is a bench off this street where the bench is which was filmed on The Fault in our Stars. Well the actual bench was stolen but you can visit the replacement which is in the same location. The bench has many locks fastened to it so you can't miss it.
Pure Amsterdam.. Staying in this area and overlooking this canal. It is fascinating just strolling and watching the river traffic go by. Lots of little shops and restaurants along the way.
Relaxing. Strolling along the canal is relaxing. Seeing all the historic buildings that many have not changed in centuries.

Beautiful view!. Herengracht canal is beautiful with an assortment of gorgeous architecture all around - it's a lovely spot for a photo op or to just wander taking in the views while exploring the city.

Gorgeously beautiful canal!. We stayed on the Herengracht Canal at Banks Mansion. The canal is beautiful and the bridges, cafes, and boutiques are numerous! We walked along the canal, as well as took a canal boat tour and loved every minute!
Nice View. Ive pass by many canals in amsterdam but this one is really nice to look at. I have a my picture and its a night version of this.

The beauty of Jordaan district of Amsterdam. Piece and tranquility of Amsterdam. Heregracht canal is the essential part of Jordaan district with lots of painting galleries along side the canal, cozy cafes cute houses. It's spectacular in the evenings when the bridges over the canal with all illuminations.
Nice. This canal looks very cozy. Not wide and the buildings looks pretty. Nice walking on the border with canal but pay attention with cyclists
The perfect Amsterdam canal. Our hotel (Ambassade) was centrally located on the Herengracht. The canal evoked all of our visions of what an Amsterdam canal should be! Charming.

Walk here to take in the architecture. This is where you want to be if you like 17th century architecture. The oldest house I am aware of in the city, from the 16th century, is still standing along this beautiful canal, too.

Excellent part of the canal system. Herengracht goes on for quite a long distance along the canal system and is well worth a visit. There are numerous beautiful old gabled houses along the canal and is a photographers dream.

Best to see from a boat tour. We've been sailing through this area in a boat. It was a nice execursion giving overview of Amsterdam's history and most prominent people living here. In a boat you can see more within an hour than exploring this area by foot. The boat was leaving from pier near Central Station.
Great cafes, amazing vibe. Lovely spots by the canal, ideal to enjoy a coffee or wine after shopping and boat watching. Essential Amsterdam

Wonderful stroll along this canal, full of historical buildings. Living in Amsterdam is always a pleasure, strolling along the Herengracht in the sunshine is always a calming and exciting experience. Looking at the different architecture and enjoying people watching.

The Most Prestigious Street in Amsterdam. We stayed at the Ambassade Hotel located right in the middle of the Herengracht area. This is considered to be the most important canal neighborhood in the city. Only the richest merchants, influential people and mayors lived in lavish homes on this canal. The oldest house was built in 1590 near 81. It's a traditional merchant's house with a beautiful step gable.The mayor of Amsterdam's house is located at 502 with the white pillars. This 45 room home was originally built in 1665 for Paulus Godin, slave trader and director of the Dutch West India Company. Later, in 1926, the house became mayor's residence. The mayor lives on the third and fourth floors. The merchant's house on 497 was built in 1664. In 2004, the house was the main location for the Amsterdam sequence of the movie 'Ocean's Twelve' with with George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Andy García, Julia Roberts, Don Cheadle, Bernie Mac. Today it's the Cat's Cabinet, a museum with works of art dedicated to cats.

Loved the Herengracht area. Stayed at the Ambassade with a lovely view of the canal. Many nice places for shopping and for eating. As a vegan was thrilled by how many places served healthy food midst the classic cheese shops and lovely pastry places.
Nice for a stroll but nothing more. Like all the areas in amsterdam, You will see a few nice bridges, canals, and have to dodge crazy bikers. All the areas look very similar.

Take the boat tour!. I would suggest you take one of the canal tours to truly appreciate the houses, houseboats and the scenery. You won't have to keep dodging the suicide cyclists if you are on the boat!

You cannot vitit amsterdam without walking the canals and taking a boat ride.. You cannot vitit amsterdam without walking the canals and taking a boat ride. Fascinating, historic and up to date since all these wonderful looking old (and some new) buildings have been lovingly maintained.

Yes, the typical and expected picture of Amsterdam. you see the typical and expected picture of Amsterdam. it is hectic arround this area: pedestrian, cylists, motorcyclists. Then this nearby picture of silcend under the streed - the Gracht. This is exactly why we are going here.

Beauty and calm. Beautiful and calm river place for visitors.
Anyway you can see too many sights in Amsterdam like this.
River, small bridge are a part of Amsterdam beauties.

Beautiful grand conaal of Amsterdam away from Tourism.... Take time to walk along the canaal, and further out into the residential areas of The Amsterdaamers, and Dutch life. You miss so much remaining in the tourist areas of the city, so break out, go out and along.
Find many bars, places to eat, micro economy stores, and great character in little sub districts.

Beautiful homes on a beautiful canal. We stayed at a nice apartment on Herengracht near Raadhuistrat, the cross street. lots of activities and people watching and on the weekends, boats boats boats. Some people playing music and some singing, a very upscale street to roam around and find special shops and restaurants. A really nice canal to make a home to live in. Nearby grocery shopping.

One of the Trinity of Canals. Known as the Gentlemen's Canal in a neighbourhood filled with canals attracting tourists. The Canal cruise offers a different perspective from the walk along the banks featuring the beautiful and ornate architectural homes of the rich bourgoise of the past.

I bet the film crew ate here !. I found this place when out looking for the bench form the movie, 'the fault in our stars'. It had been a long walk. There were an infinite number of points between our lodging and this location, but had we been lodging twice as far away, then there would have been twice that number in that larger infinity. Anyhow... The restaurant provided a welcomed place to dine after our first attempt at a photograph at the bench and a place to gather our strength for the second ! .... Yes you may have to queue to sit on the bench. We both opted for the burger which in itself was delicious and well prepared. The fries were hot and crispy on the outside and served with mayo and Tom ketchup. There was also a delicious little salad that was beautifully dressed and prepared. The only negative is that the burgers did cost 17.50 euros (although I might still be adjusting to the pound's devaluation post brexit vote). There might be faults in our stars, but not in this food.

Beautiful canal district. You can pay for a canal tour or just stay in a canal district hotel. Particularly if you are mobility limited, staying in teh Herngracht, the neighborhood surrounded by canals, will give you the experience of Amsterdam with little walking. Just look out your window!
such a wonderful place to stay. Our hotel was in this area and you are in walking distance to so many attractions. The canals are truly wonderful.
Good for a leisurely, carefree stroll. One of the posh localities in Amsterdam. Great for a leisurely stroll. Beautiful buildings all around.

By far my favourite!. My favourite canal we visited in Amsterdam as it is a little out of the way from the main 2. We were here on a lovely sunny day and it was just beautiful. The people that live here are very lucky.

Another Lovely Canal. Sailed down here on our boat cruise. It is known as the Gentleman's Canal. You will see some extremely beautiful houses on either side of the canal that originally were owned by rich merchants.

The Gentlemen's Canal. The Herengracht is lined by some of the finest houses in Amsterdam which were owned by merchants in the centuries after the canal was dug.A canal boat trip should take you down this canal where again you can see the narrow houses with elaborate gables and furniture hoists for bringing in large heavy items.The bottom end of the canal is called the 'Golden Bend' because of the larger elaborate, and probably very expensive, houses here.

Beautiful. One of the several sections of Amsterdam that encourages people to stay after one visit. Easily manageable because of the layout and size, but you can get lost in the fantastic Dutch architecture, great food and mesmerizing canals.

Lunch by the canal. On our second day in Amsterdam we sat by the canal and ate some tapas we had bought from the local supermarket. It was magical. A really lovely part of the city with barges floating past with tourist waving and smiling at eachother. It was one of my most enjoyable experiences sitting with my legs dangling above the water surrounded in the most beautiful flowers and people :) A lovely feel for how Amsterdam was in the early 1900's. Alot of architecture fully intact and well maintained. Streets kept very well with a nice local ambience about it. Can't wait to do it all over again <3

More canals, plus some shopping. Herengracht, is one of the main rings of canals in Amsterdam, some of the main attractions such as the nine streets (small shopping boutiques) and intersections are on Herengracht.
Delicious dinner . Had a great dinner and was fairly priced. Had outside plaza downstairs that was really nice. The burger was delicious!! Definitely recommended.

Herengracht in the Jordaan neighborhood. Good for seeing historical classic Dutch architecture. Grand canal houses, along with the Nine Streets" shopping area. See also the Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht canals.
Such cute part of the many canals that enchant the city. As with many other canals of the city, this is another one worth walking by. Nice area with nice old buildings and shops plus cafes around.
Always lovely to walk down. Walking around is a pleasure but watch out for bicycles. We walked along it several times and it is pretty and clean.
Lovely Walk. This canal is lovely to stroll beside, the are a few bars and shops to visit too. There are various styles of canal houses to see too.
Old world charm. The grachts in Amsterdam are a travellers delight. The buildings lining these grachts are old with their own unique architecture.

So charming - beware the bikes. This area captures the spirit of the local charm. One thing that stunned us was the massive number of bikes on the narrow cobbled streets driven by people who didn't follow directions, without helmets and also had toddlers sitting in front or behind of the rider. At night, they don't use their headlights and its dangerous at the intersections when they cut in front of themselves. It all adds to the memory of visiting this unique area. But be careful, we were nearly hit 8 different times.

Typical Amsterdam-ish feeling. The walks around the cannal are the best way to experience Amsterdam and its potential. We stopped in Herengracht for a beer on the cannal side and it was lovely. We recommend to walk a lot when in this city, to fully feel its glory!
Lovely!. Herengracht is one of the Canals/streets that runs right the way around the city. Beautiful, and peaceful. Great place for a stroll.
Nice canal view. It's really a wonderful experience when in Amsterdam. Even all canals looks the same, it's such a beautiful view during the cruise
Nothing special. Hi there,I been in Amsterdam in January,This place is nothing special maybe if I would be summer could be different,Amsterdam is only good for a weekend.

Oh! Gone back to Dreamworld !!!. This is one of the most beautiful spots in Amsterdam to spend time with your partner , holding hands, and feeling n expressing your love for each other.It's just amazing , what a beautiful, serene n happy place can do to you..... Create magic in the Air.That's what is what you feel here. Do spend a good , quality time with your family/ friends/ kids here... It does bond You.Getting hereis easy. Just follow the map, n be sure of the canal side u r walking on, as there are many canals in Amsterdam, you might get confused.
Quiet and fun at the same time!. This is a great walking canal with beautiful houses and side streets going off in many directions for unique shopping and small places to eat.

MAGICAL. For me amsterdam its all about the canals , and the herengracht is one of the best. in the past the rich people were living there, well also today, but thanks to the past youll find there amazing cnal houses and beautiful shops and restaurants. you should go to the jordaan area

Old Amsterdam. Like the Jordaan a walk aroound the Gracht is like talking a walk around old Amsterdam. Interesting views of the old houses and the canal itself. Take a leisurely stroll and stop for a coffee.
Calendar view canal !. Refreshing & clean canal. Lines of boats gives you a kind of calendar photo shots. Restaurants abounds.

canal tour. a must in Amsterdam in the canal boat trip 1 hour for about 10 euros, It is worth just to get off your feet and a great way of seeing all the history and sights of the city with a commentary
Terrific canal views. Nice canal in central Amsterdam with good views. Nice place to go on a sunny summer afternoon. Plenty of boats on the canal.

Nice scenic canal. One of the many Canals in Amsterdam.
Definitely work a walk to it if you are out and about exploring amsterdam.

some of the wealthiest Dutch lived here (and probably still do). any canal tour will include this gracht. The boat operator will explain anything worth seeing and taking pictures of (and there are many); the buildings are wonderful and you just have to marvel at how old these structures are.
Beautiful. Great views over the lovely canal, Herengracht is one of Amsterdams most beautiful streets! Great place for a wander!!
One of the Three major canals in Amsterdam. The Herengracht canal is one of the prettiest canal. The Golden Bend is filled with lovely mansions.

our hotel was in this beautiful street. A mixture of beautiful houses running each side of the canal
Some of the canal cruise boats travel down this canal to point out the Mayor's house and other very grand 17 century residences
It's a canal. So... this is a canal. Largely in picturesque parts of town. I guess you can look at it? I'm not clear on what there is to say about a canal.

Major canal in Amsterdam with coach houses. You can enjoy from a canal cruise and check the coach houses or floating houses in the canal. You can also walk by its sides among the trees and catch the details of the lovely mansions along side. *Tip: very useful to download Amsterdam map on your mobile or tablet and it will walk you through. It is the perfect guide.
Lovely canal. Quintessential Amsterdam, a tree lined canal with traditional 17th century mansions behind. A lovely place to wander with the odd canal side cafe to stop and grab a drink in.

Another nice Gracht. This is yet another nice Gracht ( canal) . You could take a pleasant stroll on its banks or do a river cruise. Plenty of lovely buildings all around and looks pretty much the same as the rest of Amsterdam !

Lovely to view by canal boat. Spent an hour cruising the canals on a lovely spring day. To look up at the walkers, hot and crowded made us appreciate the ride even more. We did walk the area in the evening and it was wonderful. There are nice shops and restaurants.
Lovely Canal. One of the 3 main canals in Amsterdam, where the rich built their houses. It is very pleasant to walk along beside the canal or go on a boat trip down it.

As much canals in Amsterdal you visit, so much delighted you are. Another of the Amsterdam´s beautiful canals to be visited either by walking or on boat trip... The advantage of a boat trip is a lacking temptation to visit all the attractive boutiques, restaurants, bars and other places and subsequent danger of expenses...or better: the temptation is there but hard to be materialized.
Every Gracht is a nice to see. The view of the gracht is unique. I'd buy a sight seeing tour by boat to see the gracht. costed me about 9 euro for an hour.

Perfect place to walk and watch. The path by the canal is always a delight with the house-boats, small cafes and so many lovely old house fronts. When you wander down here - perhaps heading to the Jewish Quarter - it's hard to realise how close you are the busy main streets. Take your time, and take lots of pictures to capture the essence of Amsterdam.
Nice "gracht". One of the main canals in the middle of the city. If you take a boat you can make excellent photos from the old houses on both side of the gracht.
Beautiful area. This was a lovely area to visit and close to Central Station. Lovely canals and buildings along the edges. Worth a stop.

Amazing attraction. The most photogenic gracht in the centre of the city. Especially with the sunset or sunrise. You can take the boat from the pier close to the Central Station and see all grachts (channels),
Great for an evening stroll. Take in the ambience of the gentleman's canal. Great for a stroll after your evening dinner and extremely nice around the 9 streets.
Golden views of merchants homes. The rich merchants built homes here, some resplendent with gables of unique shapes, so this canal displays the rishes of centuries past.

Lovely area to wander slowly through. We stayed in this area, and found it to be a wonderfully relaxed location in which you could potter in and wander slowly about. It has a few places to eat, and lies in the nine steet district with all its wonderful and unique shops to explore.

Lots of History Here. Called the Gentlemen's Canal because of the wealthy residents, today it has businesses, a museum, hotels and restaurants. To see it from the canal, take one of the canal cruises. It's very scenic and kept well. At one time it was at the outer edge of the city, now it's convenient to many sights.On nice days we saw many people eating lunch or just passing time on the side of the canal.

Lovely walk. As Herengracht is one of the most famous streets in Amsterdam, it gives a lovely impression of how Amsterdam used to be. You can see the history in the buildings and the canals, as well as the modern adaptation. There are many offices now in many buildings. Walking along Herengracht makes a nice, away from the crowds, look into the picturesque tree lined canals and gorgeous and luxurious town houses.

Even more astonishing as there 400 years old. Known as the gentleman's canal, is first the first of the major canals within the city, as history has it peter the great once stayed here during a visit. Like all the canals this one is nice to stroll along taking it all in.

Number 2 of the 5 old canals. Walk or bike, there's no other or better way .... well, by sightseeing boat of course :-)) which gives you an even better view of the old houses + a (hopefully) interesting and/or very informative lecture. You can easily spend a whole day (boat/bike/legs) if you add the four other semi circular canals of the older center.

Can't miss this gracht. Whatever you go to do in AMS, you will eventually stumble upon this gracht. Located in the center of the center, this gracht has some of the most impressive buildings of Amsterdam to show ...
the best place to take a walk. nice view of the canal and building nearby. connecting to Dam square making it easy to reach. getting a map is a must as the maybe a bit confusing with a lot of lane.
Good views. A great place to take some memorable photographs, beautiful canal side scenes and very pleasant and relaxing

Fantastic . We walked along that street in the afternoon and loved the buildings and architecture all around. The canal was so peaceful with tons of boats floating around. This is a great place for a stroll.

It is where I have lived for 5 years, one of the best grachts of Amsterdam. I have lived at number 342 and worked at 442 for 5 years. It is one of the best area of Amsterdam, a must walk when you are there.
Beautiful canals cruise. Highly recommend taking the canals cruise to see a lot more than you can on foot. They give you a running commentary on interesting places and facts.
A Must!. When visiting Amsterdam for the first time, and with intention to get a grasp of what this place was during the Golden Age, go and stroll along Herengracht and fantasize,.... Just a little.
A beautiful place to stay. A great location , within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go . Lots of good coffee houses and restaurants nearby .
Pretty walk. You can't get lost, so you may as well enjoy strolling. Find the "9 Streets" and go shopping! Take plenty of pictures, but remember that people actually live along this street.
Beautiful canals of Amsterdam. The canals in Amsterdam are a treasure. See them both on foot, and from the canal bus. Many great restaurants and cafes everywhere!

Hotel and restaurants. Stayed at the ambassade here which is amazing. But the whole street makes the experience. So nice and quiet yet literally two blocks from the center of the hustle/bustle of Amsterdam. Herengracht the restaurant has great cocktails! Day or night.

Nice stroll through the Gracht. This area with the Herengracht canal as its centre, is a lovely place for a stroll.
Saw many museums and historic buildings along the way. Good to digress from the main Central - Damrak square and walk down the canal roads near the Centrum
Museums, small hotels and restaurants. Lovely, quiet, attractive area. Visited Van Loon historic house, Museum of bags and purses, stayed in hotel on Herengracht.

Strolling in history. A day trip to Amsterdam, to visit several smaller museums, you have to stroll though the "grachten" to get there. Currently all was nice and clean, what was different in the past!!!!
Pretty. Stayed at the Hoxton on Herengracht. Went on a canal cruise that took you down Herengracht, so pretty.

Amazing.... Lovely to walk around... Or bike and just relax watching the water... Simply magic
There are several street crossing this area full of nice cafe and snack bar.. Super recommended
Canal Trip. Did an hour canal trip and really enjoyed the sights and sounds of Amsterdam as we cruised down the Herengracht.

great stroll. Enjoy the views. Children's rating 3/5. As the other canals that surround Amsterdam Centrum, this is a great one for a stroll. It is also the one that crosses the posh areas of downtown with the nicest and most expensive houses alongside it. Again, if you carry a stroller make sure you look ahead before you chose which sidewalk you walk in because not all of them are good for strollers and can be a challenge. This area is quiet and nice and charming. Make sure you also see the canal in a boat cruise, it changes the perspective of it.

The Best. the Herengracht has the biggest and sumptuous houses, ” The Canal of the Aristocrats” was the noblest address in Amsterdam during the golden age, but shorter houses in another canals( especially in Jordaam area) are also pretty.I recommend to the romantics (like me) to try the two-hour night cruise with wine and cheese or a two- or three-hour dinner. The former run nightly year-round for 25€. Dinner cruises run nightly April through November, around twice per week in winter for 70€. Reservations are required.

Just Meander and Enjoy. Take some time to wander through the canals on the Herengracht, Kaisergracht, Princegracht etc. Some brilliant camera angles here. Sit and watch the world go by. Look up at the amazing houses which date from the early 17th Century. Amazing.

Nice peaceful area. If you find yourself on your own in the city this entire area really is a must do. I took a morning to myself to explore these beautiful canals and was not disappointed. The surrounding area was beautiful with all of the slanted buildings really flexing the character of the older areas of the canal belts of Amsterdam. The one drawback (being my own fault), was the rain!

Nice area for a stroll. This is a typical canal street in Amsterdam and a nice area for a stroll. However the footpaths are narrow and there always seems to be some work going on on them so be careful stepping off them and onto the cycle paths. There are not too many shops worth talking about here but there is the odd lovely corner bar!

lovely area for walking and restaurants. this is a great area away from the main commercial shopping area. Close to the 9 streets, boutique shopping. Some great restaurants and cafes. friendly and quiet.

Just a walk to have an idea about Amsterdam. It is one of the most known canals in Amsterdam. Due to the fact that there are various shops, restaurants and cafés around it many tourists, choose to have a walk next to it. Overall it was not something special but provided an idea about what Amsterdam wants to show that is.

Beer Heaven. The Arendts Nest is one of Amsterdams premier beer bars. It has 30+ beers that are brewed in Holland only . This is the only bar in Amsterdam to have only Dutch beers. It is also the start of a four bar pub crawl which if you complete in a day you get a free t-shirt. .We did it with ease and all four bars were superb , really top top pubs!

A lovely walk, with great places to eat and drink. We walked a lot along the banks of this canal, and enjoyed the Arandsnest pub , and a superb meal at Brasserie Ambassade, both of which are on Herengracht. But it is beautiful to admire the Dutch architecture from years gone by.

Herengracht one of the main canals in Amsterdam. CANALS OF AMSTERDAM – DE AMSTERDAMSE GRACHTENAmsterdam, the capital of the Netherlands, has more than one hundred kilometres of canals, about 90 islands and 1500 bridges. The three main canals, Herengracht, Prinsengracht and Keizersgracht, dug in the 17th century during the Dutch Golden Age, from concentric belts around the City, known as the Grachtengordel. Alongside the main canals are 1550 monumental buildings. Some other beautiful canals are, Singel, Zwanenburgwal, Brouwersgracht & Kloveniersburgwal.
Wonderful mansions all along this canal. Magnificent mansion houses along this canal, old merchant houses.Fine houseboats moored either side. Great views on the canal cruise boats
Nice area. The 9-straatjes area is very nice and has many interesting little shops which turn this area in a sweet discovery.

Great city walk.. breathe it all in. Herengracht is a great site to take in on your city walk. You are surrounded by water, the history of the city, and the modern dynamic ans diverse workforce running to and from meetings. Old, yet fascinating.. I have known this area for so long but never really explored it. I read somewhere that Herengracht is considered as the most important canal in Amsterdam. The reason being, many important businessmen and mayors of the city had lived here in the 17th century. On a Christmas day, I felt so bored and decided to get out of my cozy nest. It was a cold day but I guess Amsterdam never ceases to surprise me. What fascinated me most is the houses/ buildings at the canal. Depending on the shape or design of the gable, you can predict the year when the house/ building was built. I learned something new again that day. Some of the buildings have interesting stories. For example, the House of Bartolotti on Herengracht 168-170. The name does not sound Dutch at all. It's Italian. Well, the house was an inheritance from a successful merchant of Bologna for his Dutch nephew (who later adopted his uncle's family name).Or take the house on Herengracht 81. The physical appearance isn't as "stylish" as the Bartolotti house. But there is a story for that too. The house is the oldest building where people used to live in (Dutch: woonhuis). It was built in 1590. It was used by a merchant family. The lower floor was used as dwelling area. The upper floor functioned as a warehouse. These two houses are just a couple of examples of the many interesting canal houses in Herengracht.There were many bars/ cafes around the canal. So, don't worry if you feel tired or hungry from all the walking. If you take a walk in winter time (as I did), bear in mind that the day is quite short. That day the sun set at around 4 pm. There was no sun during the whole day.
Canals. Fabulous route to walk through from shopping to coffee shops. Looks better from the boats on a canal trip.
what a place. perfect street to see the real Amsterdam rain sleet or snow this is real Amsterdam catch a ferry to take you all the way around the city by water way and it is free!

It offers some remarkable architecture that date back from the Golden Age when merchants display their wealth by commissioning the building of luscious housing. The more wealthy the merchant, the more extensive the outside ornaments and architecture.

While we were there, an unusual Christmas light show was installed over one section of the canal, which was unique in the installation (across the canal). We could not figure out how it was installed or the (power) source of the illumination (decided it must be chemical), but it was awesome and indicative of 'free treats' along the canal.You can visit the Bag and Purse Museum there, (we did not go), but the best Museum is the Canal House Museum, which we highly recommend.

Prestigiuos canal. One of the most important canals in A'dam. The mayor lives here.Important governors used to live here, the importance being shown by the width of their house (compare: Herengracht 532 houses, to Prinsengracht 1131 e.g.) There are 423 monuments here. Plan has been designed from 1613 onwards, by the mayor of A'dam (Mr. Oetgens and his city-carpenter, Mr Staets). The first city plan in the world at the time.

Beauty!. I find it one of the most beautiful canals in amsterdam, the architecture of the residential houses and the bridges makes it a wonder. Best experienced with a boat!
Watching life go by..... A great place to rest and study your maps, have a coffee, and people watch in a VERY Amsterdam setting.

15/10 WOW you must eat here - you won't regret it and we challenge you to find better food or service. OMG this was an accidental find. Staff were amazing friendly and went above and beyond. Only wanted a quick refreshment stop but ended up staying for dinner and so glad we did. Had the set meal of 3 courses and have to say that it was the most delicious meal I have ever had and they even happily obliged to take off the beetroot as I have a phobia of the stuff and they didn't batter an eye lid. Chef came out and talked us through the meal, a starter of noodles, white bait and cray fish, followed by the most succulent dish of lamb chops, lamb stew and seasonal vegetables and then the most decedent white chocolate and raspberry cheesecake, the lightest chocolate moose and raspberry sorbet that had me wanting to scrap the plate clean. Will be back for our 10th Anniversary dinner!

This and Princengracht are the most elegant. Some houses have been transformed in boutique hotels, some in restaurants or shops but it is still a residential area. A nice hour walking will permit to walk the entire gracht and come back to the same starting trough the parallel Pincengracht.

Get on a boat tour to see it best. The most central of the main canals, once again this is probably best seen by boat tour. Herengracht is closest to things like the Flower market and some of the museums.
Great for strolling. Loads to look at places to stop and eat, drink. Nice little shops along the canal side. Watch out for bikes!!!

Stargate. Cool place. We stayed at a hotel that was a conversion of three Amsterdam houses. Perfect location, within 15 minutes walk of the railway station. At the top, closest to our hotel was a blue ring over a canal bridge. Its stargate, really it is. We came fed up to the Dam and found a fantastic, experience.
Another pretty canal. Since I stayed in the neighborhood I was wondering a lot in this street. Many bridges over the water and many cafes on the canal and in the streets nearby.
Great street. Great food and shopping, and sites on this street. Go to the Herengracht restaurant for dinner or a drink
Lovely!. Another lovely canal. Take a stroll or bike and just soak in the sceneries. Don't forget to take pictures too.

A wonderful place . It was in our way from flower market to the museums area , it is wonderful view over the bridge that is decorated with colorful flowers in the corners with the boats passing inside it , we took a lot of nice photos and we enjoyed the view so much , it is realy beautiful
Uniqueness at its best.. Again very different building and streets to look at. So using your eyes to look up and down is a bonus. To be able to see the bridges and canals is worth a visit.

This is where the 1% live. The Herengracht has some of the largest and most elegant of the canal houses (homeowners in the old days were taxed based on the width of their houses, which is why there are so many narrow, tall houses in Amsterdam). Many of the canal boat tours spend time on the Herengracht; it's a great way to see it.
Architecture, History and canal life. Hotel was on the Herengracht and we walked it everyday. It is a beautiful canal with lots of additional bridges and canals to explore.

Splendid. The "Herengracht" is supposed to be the most beautiful of all the "grachten" of Amsterdam. Indeed you can spot here some beautiful mansions. The "Gouden Bocht ("Golden Bend") between Leidsestraat and Vijzelstraat, is the most prestigious part of this "gracht".
A beautiful canal in the old area of Amsterdam. A beautiful canal in the old area of Amsterdam. Lots of lovely residential and commercial establishments nearby.

Was really disappointed. Was really disappointed when I went to have drinks at the bar at De Hernengracht. According to Dutch law, restaurants and bars are now non-smoking. Yet customers were smoking at De Herengracht and the staff was providing them with ashtrays. This to my knowledge, is against the current Dutch non-smoking law. When I pointed it out to the staff, I was rudely told that De Herengracht had decided to disregard the law. If you're looking for a nice smoke-free evening, avoid De Herengracht
a must on the canals. this is also an area you must explore beeing in Amsterdam , it gives you so much back , just enjoy and experience the life og amsterdam

The oldest and the most important canal of Amsterdam, and just as beautiful as others. It is considered to be one of the oldest canals of Amsterdam. It is still very important as it serves the purpose of commercial communication through the canal, tourist rides, etc. From the 17th century the area was used for settlement by the rich, the wealthy and the most important people of Amsterdam. The settlement here is still considered as prestigious. The canal is well maintained and is beautified with colorful flowers. It was lovely taking snaps here, just walking beside the canal aimlessly, taking a ride in the water, or just having food beside the canal in one of the many eateries beside it. There are multiple other shops here and tourist information centers as well. The place is very crowded and touristy for all these reasons.
beautiful. It was so prety walking this canals. All the canals of Amsterdam, but especially this one. The houses by the side ar e so pretty and elegant.
Dutch Architecture. You should definitely have a walk along the canals to have a view of the architectural pattern of the city. Herengracht is one of the canals that shouldn't be missed.

Wider, grander, impressive, the heart of empire?. Like Prinzengracht, but in some ways grander and not so intimate.
Wide variety on an architectural theme, and a passage through the very grand to the somewhat run-down. Worth the leg work and the hazard of silent bicycles with imperious bells!
Enjoy a walk and sit for a drink. A dreamy walk around one of my canals in the city. You can find stores and restaurants around. Sit and enjoy!
to be visited. impressive but a bit "cold" with large houses and buildings. a famous canal to visit as one of the amsterdam styles
Comfortable bistro on the canal. We stopped in while walking by and were happy with the experience. Remember, however, that they have an internal courtyard that you might want to try.

The highlight of our trip was The refurbished Ryjks Museum!!. We experienced The Herengracht included in our booking with the river cruise.
The local guide was very good, much better than the short 2 hr cruises booked on the river!

Buy the DK Eyewitness Travel Guide. I would recommend buying this travel guide just for the extensive section on the Canal Walk, which explains in detail many of the buildings along the 3 main canals.
Just as beautiful as the other canals. Great views, beautiful houses and a perfect activity to stroll around and hop in one of the many stores and cafes at the canal.

Very interesting and picturesque. The canal route is covered by the canal cruise but would recommend a walk along this canal. Get a real feel of old amsterdam , really worth the slow , random walk. What better way to get a good look at amsterdam?
Gorgous canal. This was a quiet, peaceful, picturesque canal. Our B&B, 4. Sunhead of 1617, was located on this canal. I could not image a more lovely canal.
Nice walk along the canal. Beautiful houses all along the canal, it is sure an amazing place to wonder around day or night... I recommend
Has it all. A great place for shopping, having a quiet drink, fairly quiet on a sunday, lovely for a morning walk.

Herengracht canal sightseeing tour. Beautiful buildings and street life and great camera and photoshot opportunities seen from a canal cruise and also allowing us to drift slowly past the houseboats at the same level
For early sunday morning. In you want to feel the richt atmospher, visit this part of Amsterdam on a early sunday morning when there is no traffic.
nice gracht. you can feel the Flair of Amsterdam in this road. Many bars and also Shops you will find here. Come an see yourself - it's beautiful.

A must see when in Amsterdam. Great mall with unique shops in a turn of the century building. You would never know it was a mall from the outside. It looks like 1st floor shops and offices upstairs, but it is 4 floors of shopping.

One of the nicer canals, visit by boat. This is one of Amsterdam's prettiest canals, but it is best experienced if you are going by boat or peddle boat, that way you have a lower position and really can enjoy all the different houses and their facades.

Homely Herengracht. Along this magnificent street, you will see the homes built by the wealthiest traders and merchants. We not only walked it but saw if by the canal which gave you a different perspective. Most of the best buildings are now occupied by banks and embassies.
Picture Worthy. Worth visiting and taking a picture. Nothing says Amsterdam quite like a picture with the canal. This is the perfect spot to show all your friends that you've visited Amsterdam :)

You did not visit Amsterdam if you did not walk this canal.. For tourists this is a must see when you visit Amsterdam. Take a map of Amsterdam and locate the canal for a tour through a typical Dutch canal. Winter or summer, it has all its own charm.
Amazing Amsterdam. Cosmopolitan city.....Friendly and inviting people. Canals and its design were clear built around Central Station area.
Typical Amsterdam experience. Very pretty view, there are canals all over Amsterdam buzzing with life of people and multiple bicycles.
Herengracht canal in Amterdam. Beautiful canal with lovely stores, restaurants and cafes. Great are for people watching. Many interesting and electic places to eat.

The Gentleman's Canal. Living here for 4 years, this was a great place to ride the bicycle! The wideness of it, the prettier houseboats, the cafes and restaurants, and the shops all make this a great place to stroll or ride on.
Beautiful but crowded. Best street of Amsterdam, but very busy with tourists. It's hard to get around as a local. Great place to read a magazine watching the boats on the canals.

Herengracht Amsterdam, the Gentleman is the highest rank attainable.. The Herengracht, Gentlemen's canal, is home to the most fancy houses on all canals. It shows the Dutch mentality of the 17th century. There are several canals, the Prinsengracht (prince's canal), Koningsgracht (king's canal), keizersgracht (emperor's canal) and the Herengracht. Each one is a little more fancy then the next, and the most important were the rich tradesmen, the gentlemen in the Netherlands, so the most fancy canal is the Herengracht. It has the most beautiful houses and is certainly worth to walk along the canal and explore the gables of the houses
Beautiful canal. We enjoyed this canal on a boat trip. The views are spectacular. The information provided while on the boat made it an experience that will last for a long time.

nice. Stayed here and loved, quite a nice area to stay, really calm and safe, I walked far during the night and felt like home.There some places opened during the night so if you want to grab something to eat is nice and easy.
Wonderful food and service. Very cool courtyard in the back, so don't stop and sit in the main area. Also very nice outdoor right on the canal dining as well.

My favourite canal!. We stayed on this canal and it is peaceful & beautiful. Very calm & appreciated after the chaos of the red light district & Dam square. Lots of shops, lots of great architecture. A definite must stroll
Together with the other canals the highlight of Amsterdam. If you don't have a lot of time, better to walk along the canals and like inside the curtainless houses than doing a museum...

Yummy, but the service could be better. Best meal we ate in Amsterdam. Appetizer Chef Special was a surprise and amazing.
My son loved the Steak Tartar and I enjoyed the day's fish/risotto special.

Sail through might, money and history.. By all means one of the strong parts of the city. Why ? here was the money ! heren means lord, sir, not necessary with a title like in the UK but with a very high level in society. They made their mansions at this canal, which wealth was measured by its width, as taxes were paid by width of the houses (there fore most houses are narrow and high). Today multinational corporations have aquired many of the buildings and the scent of money and might still hangs in the air. herengracht is charming, beautifull, tasteful and very green from April to October. It must be sailed in one of the tourist boats, the perception is the right one from the water.
Lovely Canal. This is the "toniest" of the Amsterdam canals and rightfully renowned for its loveliness. Lovely trees, lovely houses, peaceful water.

Do not miss Amsterdam's canals!. f you're in Amsterdam, make sure you take a canal boat trip down the network of beautiful canals...the perfect way to see the city with tranquility! Taking a stroll will offer up Amsterdam's many coffee shops, boutique's & creperies! Do not miss out!

More than Just Another Canal. There is a reason as to why this canal is known as the "Gentleman's Canal." One gentlemanly thing to do is to help people - it helped me get around the city as the Herengracht became my safe spot - if I can get to it I can get home (our lodging was on this canal).I got out a few nights to photograph the happenings on this man-made link. This image is what I got for my efforts.

Amnsterdam's most glorious canal. The Herengracht is the Amsterdam canal where you can find the most expensive houses fromn the 17th century. Rich merchants built their city palaces there. And can still enjoy the sight of then. Take a tour on one of the round about boats, eliminate the cars from your mind and look at the richest architecture Amsterdam ever produced. Remember that the upper floors were only used for store. People lived on the lower floors where the windows and ceilings are extremely high to catch as much light as it possible in wintertimes. During the summer months people moved to theirlarge summerhouses in the country side, away from the buzz of the city and the stench of the canals. The buzz is still there, but the stench has gone since the construction of the sewerage system in the 19th and early 20th century.

Amsterdam's canal network. It is so easy to get around Amsterdam on foot. There are a series of canals that encircle the city at intervals of several streets. Like the spokes of a wheel another set of canals radiate from the centre making a spiders web. Each canal (gracht) has a road along either bank. The only hazard is from cyclists. The motorists are very careful of pedestrians. This cannot be said of Dutch cyclists. they are generally rather self centred and arrogant. they don't make any allowance for pedestrians who are forced to walk in the road as the pedestrian paths are blocked with parked cycles. They ride straight at you and don't slow down at all. Herengract is one of the circular canals that we walked along side many times on our travels to town centre and the various attractions we visited.
Superb place with back garden. If its a chilly day and you want to sit out then the back garden is really cosy with a fire and comfy seats to chill out from the hub bub and hectic life of Amsterdam.

Beautiful canal. A good place to take your pictures of all the bridges over the Amsterdam canals. Look for a bridge that has one or two bicycles leaning against the wall. That makes for an authentic Amsterdam picture.
Bags of joy !!!. Visit the Bag Museum here- its just great. Fantastic cafe for afternoon tea or a bite. Don't fancy that-? nip across the canal to the Waldorf for a right royal treat !
Amazing Cityscape. Easily one of the most beautiful architectural parts of Amsterdam. We stayed on this canal during our last visit, and would definitely recommend touring the area.
One of the canals in the canal ring. Beautiful walking area. We stayed on Nieuw Herengraght which is an extension on other side of Amstel River.

Iconic canals. The canals are the most iconic attractions in Amsterdam and you will definately see a lot of them on Herengracht. This a very good area for relaxing and romantic walkings and good photographs can be taken. There are a lot of cafes and restaurants in this area, as well.
Graphic. A centrally located beautiful and graphic canal.Lots of bars,cafes,restaurants.Crowded.Parallel tothe Singel gracht (canal)
Shopping. Our hotel was near this section. So many unique cafes and shops. Lots of fun walking the canals and enjoying the architecture.
Another great neighborhood. Many things to see and do on Herengracht! Leads to such interesting and wonderful neighborhoods, restaurants, shops, and people...

Amsterdam. As you will see all over Amsterdam that you are never far a way from a canal but they are beautiful and sum up amsterdam in one picture with bikes all chained to the canal railings and boats sailing down the canal with shops and bars along each side of the canal it really is a beautiful city.
Good all year round. The main canals of Amsterdam are picturesque all year round. For us this time it was May so the greenery just added to the beauty of the canals.

Beautiful all together !. The entire city of Amsterdam is absolutely stunning but I have had the chance to spend 20 days of internship working in on of the stunning buildings of herengracht street, chich left me a lot of time to get to know the area and vue in all its details. It's really a must-see, also in one of the most dynamic areas of the city (Rembrandt Plein). Highly recommend to see the canals by boat of course, which does give you an other perspective and gives photo lovers an amazing opportunity to do what they love most !
Look up!. Lined with some of Amsterdam's most interesting architecture - take the opportunity to look up as you stroll alongside the canal, but watch out for the looney cyclists!

Crowded, Be careful of Cars, Bikes, Trains, Locals. I stayed on the Herengracht for 10 days and while it's the most peaceful of all the centrally located canals, it's still busy. After a crowded day in Amsterdam, this canal is the best to call home. It is the most elegant I believe, but it won't shelter you from the city's noises, construction, or irritants.
Wonderful. Enjoyed canal cruise and walking along this canal lined by fantastic houses. Especially interesting if you have read The Miniturist.

Just as you imagine. Herengracht is all you expect an Amsterdam Canal to be. Charming and Elegant, Just stroll or cycle day or night and soak in the atmosphere of this wonderful canal then take a boat along it and look up at the gables. Hard to think that it is so old.

Popular place for fun and good food.. We were taken to the Herrengracht Restaurant & Bar by an in-the-know friend who lives in Amsterdam. Much of the city is filled with beautiful canals and buildings with wonderful, iconic character. The Herrengracht is one of them and is surrounded by the same near the corner of Leidsestraat and Herrengracht (canal of the same name). It seems to be quite popular and was crowded when we visited and every time we passed by. It has a terrace overlooking the canal, inside seating, and then a nice patio out back. While a lot of the patrons were there just for drinks, we had just arrived on an early morning flight from the US, so we wanted an early dinner. The menu includes some Dutch items and several generic offerings of wide appeal. I had the Chilean sea bass, which had a great sear and was beautifully done. Everyone had a very nice meal and a good time. Service was great. All in all, one of our nicest experiences in Amsterdam!

Beautiful historic canal side buildings.. 17th century town houses line this canal, with lovely elm trees either side of the the narrow one way streets. This is a most attractive quiet upmarket area with a few nice shops and restaurants including top notch Johannes.
Nice canal with intersting buildings. A nice place with old buildings from rich people from 2 or 3 centuries ago. I recommend the Willet-Holthuysen museum, so nice to visit !
Very nice!. Very nice canal! Very diverse crowd. Better walk not too late at weekends if not out to party)) Nice shops opened until 7 PM - disappointment...

Gorgeous buildings. We were lucky to spend some time here and enjoyed our daily walks. Although we wandered around many canals and beautiful streets in Amsterdam, Herengracht was the most elegant and picturesque in our opinion!

Beautiful canal and neighborhood. Our hotel was on this canal and it was a beautiful place to stroll during the day or evening. Architecture is wonderful with lots of surprises as you walk along the street.

Lovely street...take a canal cruise to appreciate fully. Our hotel was on the Herengracht (Banks Mansion- lovely FYI) and they suggested a canal cruise. We took a canal cruise that went quite a way down the Herengracht and I must say that the perspective from the boat is MUCH better. Trying to get a good view of the buildings when you are on the sidewalk looking up is hard (careful to avoid getting hit by the cars and bicycles) and looking across the canals at the other side ....well the trees get in the way. From the canal you can look up through the trunks and get a great view of the canal houses....LOVELY. I am so glad we took the time to do this. I have been to Amsterdam before but didn't want to waste my time on past visits. My husband pushed for the canal cruise...I am so glad he did. It really made the Herengracht come alive.

Beautiful canal. Again a canal so is very Nice to walk along.
All about the beautiful arkitekture.
We also Walked this along the whole canal.
Beautiful

Great to wander around. You can just wander around the HG and Prinsengracht and it's great to view the house styles as well as the house boats. If you can take a boat tour as well to see these streets. Look carefully at the houses and you'll notice they lean forward, so they can hoist heavy good up on the small gantries at the top of the house.

One of the main canals in the central ring. Lots of shops, houses and restaurants on one of the historic canals in the central ring. This one was defined by the number of wealthy personages residing here and many of the homes are bigger and more elaborate than elsewhere.

Gentlemens Canal. Amsterdam's most important canal where the Mayor of Amsterdam residence sits besides. Great boat trips to view the historic buildings along this canal and pick up general information such as this!!

Elegance combines with history. Our hotel was located on the Gentlemen's Canal. Great architecture, probably best seen from a canal cruise, but also worth a wander along the streets. Take care of the traffic, bicycles everywhere!

Venice of the North. This is considered the most important canal in the city as the rich and influential folks of the city have an address here. Take a canal tour and you will be able to see one of the most photographed views of Amsterdam, the famous seven bridges of Reguliersgracht. Admire the prestigious and historical houses here at leisure.
Wonderful place. loved this area - full of history, beautiful architecture, buzzing with life and interesting people. take time to take in the atmosphere and stop and people watch.

Famous Canal in Amsterdam. The Herengracht is one of the Famous Canals in Amsterdam. The many canalhouses are a few hundred years old and all different. They are sooo pretty? I just love it. You can take a walk and simply admire them or take a canalboattrip..

Take a canal tour!!. This was a very inexpensive way to see all around Amsterdam and the canals. I think it cost us 15 euros a piece. The guided tour has head phones for each passenger and the tour is narrated in a variety of languages so that no one is left out!

Herengracht. No trip to Amsterdam is complete without having undertaken a tour of their famous Grachten! Even when it's raining, it's a trip worth taking. It's a great way to see Amsterdam! This gives you the opportunity to see the quaint and lovely architecture of many of the buildings. You will be astounded at how old some of the buildings really are! Some are really beautiful and you will be in awe most of the time! Also, you will get a chance to see along the Grachten the various kinds of houseboats that people actually live in! A visit to the Grachten is definitely one of the highlights of any visit to Amsterdam! All you have to do is sit back and enjoy!

Pretty and Regal Residences on the either side!. The Regenten or the Rulers of the old Dutch republic lived here. Hence, of all the canals, the buildings on either side of this one are more lavish and regal!
one of the best canals in terms of gorgeous buildings. take time for a stroll on this elegant refined canal with some of the best buildings in amsterdam . also some nice shops and cafes

AMSTERDAM - IF YOU LOVE FOOD AND INDEPENDENT SHOPS, DON'T MISS THIS GEM!! - HERENSTRAAT (OFF HERENGRACHT). Near to the top of Herengracht, toward Central Station, lies a very sweet side street 'Herenstraat'. Here you will you find a scattering of independent quality shops offering everything from Asian Art, leather goods, clothes but above all, no less than FOUR superb little restaurants. They say 'healthy competition' is a good thing, hence this maintains the high standards offered by these very different establishments. Short menus are also a good sign of freshness and quality, large menus often mean some elements are prepared long in advance or even frozen to avoid waste. There is SO little to distinguish between these four, however, I will try my best!! MAX RESTAURANT, don't be fooled by the slightly stark minimalist interior, especially during the day. At night, this place 'glows' and once full, becomes very cosy. Service is impeccable, professional and 'not in your face'. The food is exciting with an Indonesian twist. For example, I had the amazing lamb fillet with a wonderful sauce infused with a gentle spice and coconut, not obvious but just enough to excite! The menu is fairly short but there will be something for everyone and priced for either a two or three course meal, depending how much you want to spend or how hungry you are. Check this out online. MAX is HIGHLY recommended, great for a romantic meal for two or a party of eight or more!! SEASONS RESTAURANT - WOW!!! We hit this place the night before it closed for just a few days for a new paint job, hence there were some items off the menu. Despite this, the service, food and ambience were outstanding!! I can't comment on the decor as I haven't seen the refurbishment but it's a very cosy place. Again the menu is fairly short but exciting and full of amazing tastes and textures. I had the 'Upside Down' Beef Wellington, a deconstruction of this classic dish with prime beef served ON TOP of a light puff pastry crust infused with a whiskey/mushroom sauce, incredible!! Google the new menu online as there will again be various price options depending on the number of courses. This place ranks JOINT NUMBER 1 with MAX, I simply can't separate them. TASTE OF VIETNAM - WOW!! This has to rank as one of Amsterdam's BEST Vietnamese restaurants, a hidden gem!! Service, menu and decor/ambiance makes this a total must. Too much to say here but check out online and add to your list!! Finally CHEZ GEORGE - You will love the white table cloths, impeccable attentive service, presentation and menu. This is fine dining but not at fine dining prices. There was a fixed menu on offer the night we visited offering a good choice of meat and fish dishes in typical French style. This is the perfect place for a very quiet and intimate dining experience, very romantic. The Chef and owner takes a very front of house approach and will take great pride in serving and talking you through the various dishes. Highly recommended. IN SUMMARY, this little side street has a LOT to offer with plenty of choice in a small area and will save you trekking up and down the canals to find something special. PLEASE RATE if you found any of this helpful on your visit.
Beautiful. Beautiful. Walk, run, or people watch. Great outdoor space. A short walk from liedsplein. You pass by it on bus 197 to and from airport. Lots of hotels nearby. Lots of people.
Life on the Canal. This a a beautiful quiet part of Amsterdam, especially near the Bowersgraht. But also close to many restruants and bars
Grand Houses of times gone by. We took in most of this area on a canal trip as well as walking a lot of it. The old merchant houses all have their own stories.

Walked and cruised. This is a lovely area to walk in and cruise in. We went on the Hop on and of cruise boats.It was a quiet time of year and it wasn't too crowded or noisy.Lovely architecture and good informative commentary if you go on the boats.
Beautiful characteristic Amsterdam. Eating fresh herrings on bridge overlooking Herengracht and purchasing flowers . Did not appreciate tourist laden boats with boom boxes traversing the water ..
Lovely area to walk around. Beautiful area to have a wander around! Many of the footpaths beside the canals have no barrier, be careful not to get too close to the edge!

Great area. When in Amsterdam what do you do? You see canals!! This area is very picturesque with beautiful homes and trees on both sides of the canal. Make sure as to not fall in after a few drinks!!

A beautiful canal, lined with beautiful houses in a beautiful city!. Herengracht is so central - just five minutes' walk from the central square, Rembrandtplein, and five minutes in the other direction to the Rijksmuseum - yet it is so peaceful and calm, so beautiful, lined with mediaeval houses and dotted with picturesque bridges.....take a walk along the banks of the canal - but watch out for the cycles and the occasional vehicles coming down the narrow cobbled streets! Herengracht is full of old world Amsterdam charm - and also happens to be the location of my favourite hotel!

Tja ?. I don't know so much what to say about this place for somebody who is born in Amsterdam exept its the second canal from the 4 rampart moats we have and where Amsterdam is famous about and are called canals today Initially it was dug in 1585 and get his name in 1612. Maybe nice for tourists.... but for me there is nothing nice to see there.

Historical architecture. Another of the wonderful canal walks amongst 17th century architecture invoking an atmosphere of history exuding from the walls. Take your time and observe the architecture,the boats, the welcoming cafes and it's quiet ambience....enjoy!

A nice walk and no red lights!. Unlike Singel, you won't come across any red lights walking down the Herengracht. Full of 17th houses it takes about 20 minutes to walk, and there are plenty of cafes to visit and the 9 streets (which is a nice shopping area) is halfway down.I'd recommend this walk: pretty at night, full of twinkling lights at night and completely different during the day where little details on the buildings are revealed
Another stunning place to walk. Cute shops, narrow houses, house boats...blissfully same old. Easy to add this to your list of things to see as it runs through the center of everything.
Herengracht. The best of the Graachts Probably best to walk the Golden Bend Don't forget to visit Rembrandhuis The Canal Museum is also very worth visiting

Most fantastik canal. Rigth in the center of Amsterdam, 10 minuts from Amsterdam CS walking . Walking along the canal and simply looking at all those fantastik houses, one more spectacular than the next. All well restauratet and telling a lot of history of trading and a rich city. Do take a walk on both sides to make sure you see all the buildings from the other side. Very important do also walk in the evening and enjoy the the lamps and the special Atmosphaere. Will be back in spring and can only recomend a walk very highly.
Simply stunning architecture. Walk along the Herengracht early on a Sunday morning and you could be time travelled back to he 18th century.Beautiful architecture.

Nice arhitecture. We stayed on this canal in the near are of Dam, it s quite easy to find major attractions waling along it, the buildings look lovely, perhaps though not so majestic as on Prinsengracht. Anyhow, nice stroll to take.
Posh canal. This canal is where all the industry owners had their properties so the houses are wider than the norm (with gardens apparently at the back).

Absolute Amazing!. I loved to walk around the old town of Amsterdam and just enjoy the old architecture of the great place!
A must see for everyone!

Grachten: 1, Little Streets: 2. Yes, the grachten (Amsterdam's main semi-circular canals) are all magnificent, and the Herengracht is the grand-daddy of them all. But for really interesting discoveries of a shopping, culinary or historical nature, be sure to wander and lose yourself in as many of the little streets between the grachten.
Very pleasant. I was near the Herengracht and had a stroll up and down it. A very pleasant 45 minutes in the early spring sunshine.
Pleasant area. OK for a casual stroll and a beer or koffee wit melk in the cafes and bars that are in the immediate vicinity. Walking in Amsterdam is pleasant due to the flat terrain
Picturesque canal.. Having stayed in a hotel on Herengracht Canal you will enjoy a walk along its banks. A river cruise also comes along this canal and points out many impressive buildings.

Loads of information about the resistance movement. For adults and children. There are multiple rooms showing the different events that took place during the war from the bombing of Rotterdam to the liberations by the allies. The audio is available in Dutch and English. Allow a full hour to go through the rooms. A new section has been added which will allow visitors to follow four children through the period. While interesting for adults, this area allows children to listen to stories told by the four children and enter into rooms designed to show how families lived during the period. This museum is well done and I would recommend for anyone interested in that period of history.
Canal Cruise. This is the one of the main canals visited by canal cruises. Translates to Gentlemens Canal. Good views of Amsterdam architecture.

Cute and authentic. The Herengracht (Or gentlemans canal translated) is one of Amsterdams main canals. It's definitly worth the visit. I would recommend going on a canal tour. Don't book one at home!! If you go to central station, there is a really cheap canal tour company. It only costs €10 an adult.

Best canal view's in the city. Love walking in this wonderful part of the city,make a point of going to ARENDNEST,a great Dutch beer bar in this area and the view's of the canal is just fantastic.Lovely looking bridge and building's covering several centuries make this a great walk,very scenic with great little shop's and bar's on both side's of the canal ,mean's it well worth a visit.We like to go in the afternoon when this area is buzzing,stopping for a coffee or a beer in one of the cafe's,just superb.
Craft beer. Arendsnest, must visit for local beer, 20+ on tap and bilingual staff. Small cheese boards for hungry folk

Prettiest section of Amsterdam. This is by far the most gorgeous area of the city. Fab to see walking as well as from the canal tour boat. There was a nice canal-side bench scene for The Fault in our Stars filmed here. Quite the photo op spot. A lovely walking area.

loved the canal cruise. this is another of Amsterdams beautiful canals. lots of trendy shops, and interesting buildings (historic former warehouses)
a canal cruise is a must here

Canal Beauty. With the Light Festival on, this specific canal is beautifully illuminated with lighting designs by artists however, even without this is it a beautiful canal to visit! Whether you walk, cycle or take a cruise, you'll fall in love with the canal's beauty!

Nice walk. Our hotel was located on this canal. It's a nice walk and interesting to look at all the architecture. It is more residential so you need to look for cafes and shopping off on the side streets.

A canal street worth the walk. Nice canal street right out side the center on Amsterdam. One of the best. Well you probably knew that already. Loads of quirky boutiques and shops, lovely bridges and pretty canals. Don't forget the coffee shops of course!

our favourite canal. we stayed on this canal at Sunhead, it's a gorgeous canal made for walking as previous reviews say a different direction/time of day changes the views. As previously stated watch out for bikes although everyone is soooo friendly even if you're at fault.

Lovely. The great thing about Amsterdam is it is very walk-able and Herengracht Street offers a wonderful walk. It is a ring street that circles through the old city and ends in Amstel which is the old original part of Amsterdam. On both sides of Herengracht street are rows of old buildings covering the 15th, 16th, 17, 18th and 19th centuries. A canal runs down the centre and there are many cross streets and bridges. It crosses many other important city streets and runs parallel to other canal streets like Singel and Keisiersgracht. I stayed ay the Best Western Dam Square and was able to walk each day to all key sots along Herengracht.
Elegant Amsterdam. We stayed at hotel Ambassade on Herrengracht. Great location in lovey part of Amsterdam lots of nearby eating options and less noisy and seedy than other parts of Amsterdam.

Handbags and Purses. The Museum of Handbags and Purses was interesting. I thought it was free entry but it was actually 9 Euros. My husband was not impressed. The old house is charming and they have turned a couple of rooms into a cafe and it overlooks the canal in Herengracht.

A groovy canal. Walk the canals, stop at the bars, check out the market, some great arty bookshops too, what's not to love about wandering in the streets here? Oh - look out for the cyclists, often to be seen texting rather than looking where they're going, and being from the UK, I was mystified about cycle/pedestrian/tram priorities - made it home in one piece though.

Herengracht canal. Stunning location, stayed in a beautiful little hotel on this canal. Close to shopping, museum (Anne Frank), transport and dining. Try Arendsnes (brown cafe) on this canal. Great beer and bar snacks.

Canals, canals everywhere. You won't understand why the fascination regarding canals until you have been in Amsterdam. Although they all look the same, the culture, the neighbourhood, the time of the day gives great unique photo opportunities.

amazing canal. This is also one of the special canals that must be visited while in Amsterdam. It will give you a taste of the culture and making of the city. you can also do a boat tour. highly recommend it.

Another beautiful canal that must be experienced in Amsterdam. This is also one of the special canals that must be visited while in Amsterdam. One of the many Canals. Great walks or take a canal trip to see the variety of houses along the canal. The various canals have different styles.

Nice street in the center of Amsterdam. Herengracht is very much in the center of Amsterdam, and is lined by canals and iconic eateries. Lovely to stroll along. I had a lovely long walk along this canal before dipping into the 9 straatjes and the jordaan to look for a new home...
