The true Amstersam perhaps?. This is such a lovely area - fantastic architecture that is so typical of this beautiful city. You want to sit a little and walk a little and have a drink or lunch in one of the many eateries. Take your time and take it all in. Then go shopping...

Romantic.... Perfect place to stroll and have coffee along the canals. Different time of day you will see different colors of the canal. Do take the canal cruise for an overall cruise tour. Need not say, this is a must. Same goes for all the canals!
Beautiful, like the others. All grachts are beautiful, border the centrum, this one is used also for canal cruises and for me was special, because our hotel was situated here.
amazing canal around amsterdam. this is one of the best canal site in amsterdam, very long surrounded to amsterdam, love to walk around this canal site. centrally located.

Exeptionally exeptional. The Herengracht (Canal of the Overlords) boasts the unique architecture of the Dutch Golden Age. The facades of the houses have distinctive shapes. The street that runs on both sides of the canal is narrow, making it difficult for a car to pass a bicycle. Try to get an invitation to see one of the not modernized house from inside. Some of them have cellars that go way to the back. Some are connected to a building behind, that no passer-by ever sees. Some have a labyrint and all are beautiful. Read up on their history. You'll enjoy your visit even more.
peaceful oasis in busy city. We stayed in an apartment in a canal house along Herengracht and loved the neighborhood, the canal scenes, the nearby activity.
Great starting point. As pretty as most of the canals in Amsterdam and everything one could wish to see lies nearby either side of it.

Herengracht canal. We stayed at a B&B on the Herengracht canal. It is a beautiful canal and a perfect location to see the sights. We walked from the train station and were around the corner from the Anne Frank house. We could walk to Dam Square. We did walk to the Rijks Museum but took the tram back to Dam Square.
nice canal area. Actually, all the "gracht" streets kind of look alike; you can walk for hours along the canals, old buildings, cross the old bridges and even take boat rides.
Enjoy architecture.. Enough said. Bike ride or canal trip is the thing. This will take an hour or two days depending on your involvement.Great place not far from center.
Nice walk. We had dinner on Herengrecht one night and so had a lovely walk back and forth. It was quiet and interesting to look into the canal houses.

lovely for a stroll. A calm quiet canal with lovely homes from the 1600s where most of the houses that have been restored to perfection. Some of which one can visit. Worth the detour. We visited 2 of the homes and were impressed with the quality of the restoration.
Just a street. But interesting buildings for a walk around the canalside - but not a lot more interesting than many of the other streets nearby

One of the Three great canals. This is one of the three great canals for us. Stroll the length and take in Amsterdam from top to bottom. Not our favorite but still a great canal to walk along

Beautiful. Whether you explore this area on foot or in a canal boat, it is still magnificent. Splendid architecture interrupted by small outdoor cafes or bars makes this a very relaxed place to walk around. It has to be seen of you are visiting Amsterdam.

What a Decor!. Take a walk , follow the canal .... look at the houses and read about their history .... Beautiful architecture.

Another bikeride to work. Also on my way to work, enjoy the Grachten all together, you won't get bored. The cosy and curious streets make you want to wander around for quite some time, try some cute coffeeplaces or sandwich corners. Enjoy Amsterdam.

great walk in Amsterdam. Great street to talk along while in Amsterdam. Elegant and charming. One of the most famous, and probably the most photographed canals of the Amsterdam. Lined with traditional gabled houses, tall and narrow, their leaning forward façades are beautifully reflected in the water. Romantic and atmospheric place, yet trendy and full of life.

Walking along Herengracht. Walked from close to the Palace to Amstel River along the scenic Herengracht. Beautiful mature trees, great views of some of the best old houses in town, lots of activity on the canal, few shops. Very dangerous traffic conditions for newly-arrived tourists: bicycles and trams sneaking up on you from all directions, cyclists not always stopping for red traffic lights, some drivers stopping to let you cross - but then a bike comes tearing down the road. Little patience from other pedestrians if you forget to walk on the right-hand side of often narrow sidewalks. In terms of road surface the bikes are best off, followed by the cars. You have to look where you are going not to trip over cobblestones and manhole covers. In parts the sidewalk is taken up by parked service vehicles and thousands of locked-down bicycles. But we survived and learnt a lot. Also: when trying to find your way back to your hotel, remember that Amstel (Street) is not the same as Amsteldijk.
Main canal!. Shops, dining, people watch, sailing by or walking thru. This is one of the main canals where everything happens.

1 Dali and The Silk Road. This museum has the most famous Dali. In addition it had a development of the silk road. Can be read online. Save thy dollars.

Canal with the most museum. Herengracht is one of the canals in Amsterdam. Not only beautiful buildings on the both side of the canal but also the one with the most museum. " The Grahtenhuis" (no.386), "The Bible Museum" (no.366-368), "The Museum Geelvinck-Hinlopen Huis"(no.518), "Tassenmuseum Hendrikje"(no.573), "Museum Willet-Holthuysen" (no.605). You can find a lot buildings with history and beautiful architecture. If you come in the winter or spring you can see the beauty of the buildings more because of no trees in front of them.

Historical sightseeing. Herengracht #81 is the oldest residential house in Amsterdam. I'm so passionate about this city, so I highly recommend stopping by one of the bridges crossing the canal (there are many of them!) or sitting by the water jsut to absorb some of the city's energy.
nice boat ride. Took a 60 min canal cruise which took us around the city, we mainly went through Herengracht. It was a beautiful journey.

one of the best canals in Amsterdam. herengracht is one of the best three canals of Amsterdam with Keizergracht and prisengracht.

A walk through history. The "Gentleman Canal" was one of the two canals which was created for the residences of the Elite of Amsterdam. No warehouses were allowed to be built and the frontages appear much larger than the warehouses in other canals. One of the bends in the canal is meant to be called "the golden corner" as that is where the wealthiest residents lived.At one end of the canal is the Amstel River. At this junction is the Hermitage Museum and the "Skinny Bridge".I visited 3 museums along the Herengracht. All of which are based in stately town houses. They were :- Cat Cabinet : object d'arte of a cat nature- The handbag and purse museum, it was literally that, four floors of handbags etc. Very interesting, and a lovely café.- Museum Willet-Holthuysen, this is a mainly period furnished merchants town house.Worth the walk, but all of the canal cruises travel along this route

Herengracht, Prinsengracht & Keizersgracht (Emperor's Canal) -- 3 Great Amsterdam Streets On Canals. The Prinsengracht, Herengracht and Keizersgracht are 3 of Amsterdam’s most famous streets located on canals within the city center. These 3 streets and canals are south of Central Station (train depot) and Dam Square. They radiate south and outward from Dam Square in a curved or convex pattern, akin to the 5 lower sides of an octagon. Large sections of all 3 are walkable in a morning or afternoon. The ambiance of the canals, the architecture, the bicycles, the people and the shops, bars and cafes are what Amsterdam is all about. They are the contemporary live museums of Amsterdam. If you are interested in how and when these canals and houses were built, and good stories about some of the people you know that lived in these houses, along with the history and culture of Amsterdam and its place in the world, then read Russell Shorto’s Amsterdam, a wonderful and inspiring book, that will also inform you about the roots of individual freedom and the great advances of the Enlightenment.

Beautiful Water/Walk Way. The main boulevard of Amsterdam with some of the city's best architecture. Canal boat is good way to tai it all in, but the walk will give you the best chances to see Ye Olde Amsterdam. Nice shops and watering holes along the route.
View!. I walked along here several times. It is a breathtaking spot especially if you sit down to relax and just look around. Worth a visit or walk through.

good !. good....a bit fashion....and the people working here are sweet and efficient...specially this butch blonde nederlander man ...surounded by a team of very nice girls

The most attractive of the principal canals. The 17th century place to live for the fashionable nouveau-riche of the time, the architecture is varied and interesting. It's boardered by small quiet streets and the occasional shop and bar, as all the principal canals are, but it seems calmer.
fun neighborhood. lots of activity, small restaurants (choose carefully, a lot of them are horrible), families and youths roaming the streets, very cool spot.

Where the stately houses are.. What's not to like in this city of canals! Do a canal tour to orient yourself, and then stroll along the canals, avoiding the cyclists. Pity the parked cars prevent you walking along the edge of the canal.
Nice. Great for a quick snack and coffee although the service can be a bit slow. Been several times and enjoy the atmosphere of sitting on the canal.

just sit and relax. our hotel, rembrandt classic, was located on Herengracht Canal and we spent half an hour every evening sitting on its side, smoking a spliff, enjoying the amazing view and great smooth wind!

How People Live. We spent a week in an apartment overlooking Herengracht at Herenstrasse, a virtual parade of insights to the daily life of Amsterdam's residents. From the party boats and tour boats on the canal (I highly recommend taking a canal tour), to seeing the inventiveness of what people transport on bicycles, this was a fascinating parade. The walk along this street, with electric cars being charged and metal gutters for bringing bicycles up and down steep subterranean apartments, is interesting. It's a tranquil step back in time with lots of places to shop or enjoy refreshments.
lovely canal with pretty Amsterdam frontages!. nice to wander along in the sunshine soaking up some of the special Amsterdam atmosphere and enjoying those wonderful Dutch gables

Its a canal and there is water. Was I supposed to see something unique or special? It was a perfectly fine canal --water and all. I must say, though, that it looked much like all the other ones did. Some of the leaning houses were pretty cool.

There are lots of tourist places around here.. Our hotel was situated on Herengracht with fabulous views over the canal. There are lots of tourist places around here. We were only a short stroll to Rembrantplein, a bustling square with lots of bars and restaurants.Also nearby is the Cat Cabinet, and the Museum of bags & purses. And you will also find Waterlooplein near here, for busy street markets, the floating garden markets, and the Botanical Gardens.
a lovely walk. Excellent sites with some shops, museums (try the Bible museum) and canal as you walk this way in Amsterdam - worth the walk from the station and not to far.....
always a nice walk. a nice coffeeshop there :) and don't forget about bikers while sightseeing! have nothing to add here, you better take a walk there yourself, enjoy and smell the Amsterdam.

Beautiful!. Our hotel was on this street! Gorgeous!! (The Rembrandt Classic Hotel) Quiet street with lots of caracter. Residential, people take care of their property - nice canal for people watching passing in boats!

Beautiful canal - nice bar. If walking along the Herengracht, take time to stop at the Herengrach Bar and Grill at the intersection with Leidsestraat. In the evening it is an oasis of calm and tranquility with just the right ambience to really put you in a relaxed frame of mind. Pleasant staff and owner and reasonable prices.

Lovely strolling along the canal. Another beautiful and lovely Canal of this wonderful city, but it is exactly like the others, enjoy the strolling and the amazing panoramic view all around.
The Canal is nice and offers a stunning view, I really appreciated the beautiful buildings along it and all the typical boat sailing the Canal.
Nice and romantic atmosphere.
Lovely canal. One of the main canals in Amsterdam . This one is lovely with numerous good restaurants and cafes nearby. Good place for a meal since it is very lively all day there.

Lovely Place. the Herengracht is one of the beautiful canals in Amsterdam. If you are in spring, fall or summer at the Herengracht and it is a sunny day you see all the Amsterdam people on their boats. Just a lovely place.
Walking tour. We walked about half the length of the canal. Important to look up and admire the gables. The houses are more imposing than on other canals as this one was home to the wealthy.

Best part of Amsterdam!. The waterways in Amsterdam are unique and so full of character! Take some time to get a boat cruise around and take in the architecture of the buildings - some as old as the 1500's. it was a first for me. I'm sure it is even more interesting in the different seasons, but the summer sun did it a world of justice! Every corner is a picture perfect scene!

Beautiful canals!!. Did a boat hop on hop off pass the area and had a walk through the area as well. Very nice canals and bridges and is a good place to have a wander especially on cooler days and in th evening. Stop by one of the pubs or restaurants by the canal if you can and have a relaxing time watching boats pass by on the canal.

Another beautiful Canal. They are all pretty good in Amsterdam aren't they! The boats, the architecture, lined with trees and the street lights at night. It is a beautiful city. I could walk the canals all day!

Stately Homes. We stayed at a hotel (Banks Mansion) on this canal. It is lined by well-kept homes (including the mayor's). The name "Herengracht" means Gentlemen's canal, more or less. Be sure to look up at the ornamental roof decorations on many of the homes. One interesting incident we witnessed while eating at a canal-side restaurant was a dredge fishing out derelict bicycles and other things. The attached garbage barge was nearly filled as we ate lunch. When you see the hundreds of bikes locked to railings around each canal bridge, you can believe the numbers that are dumped!

Just go for a wander.... Prinsengracht and its neighbours Keisergracht and Herrengracht are amongst the nicest avenues in the city, and well worth a prolonged stroll. You'll find a wide range of shops and cafés, but also lots of hidden-away little-known galleries, institutes with open libraries, and other attractions. Each side street opens up into more bars and cafés and sometimes considerably more including some of the more famous attractions and squares.

Take a step back in time. I love Amsterdam and you can never get enough of the canals and bridges... I'm here for 6.5 weeks so i thought it was useful to buy a cheap bike for €65. I rode from the Haarlemmerstraat to the Bags and Purses museum and it was such a wonderful and tranquil ride, big beautiful canal houses and house boats and characteristic bridges. You feel like you're not in Kansas anymore! Put on your most comfortable walking shoes and make sure to visit if you're in town.

Beautiful streets with lovely historic buildings. A must-see while in Amsterdam, every building has some interesting feature. Lovely to meander along on a summers day but be careful of the cyclists who don't always ring their bells to alert jaywalking tourists!

Quiet canal just minutes away from most major attractions.. My wife and I really enjoyed the Herengracht canal and street for its convenient location, and for its beautifully characteristic bridges and views of Amsterdam.

Typical Amsterdam Canal. The eastern end of the canal held more interest being near Rembrandtplein and the Museum of Bags and Purses. Should have walked down here at night to see more of the lights (but in June that is very late). Not as many restaurants on the canal as Prisengracht it seems. Taking a canal tour is a good way to get an orientation.
Heaven. This is a very lovely picturesque canal conducive to walking and boat watching. We enjoyed the streets along the canal with lovely homes and flowers

Beautiful at Night. Along the Herengracht, you will find the Bridge of 15 Bridges, which looks exceptionally beautiful at night. I would recommend either taking a boat cruise or walking, alternatively cycling if you have one available. There are also some good cafés scattered around the Herengracht.

Boat tour. A fun and relaxing thing to do. The cost was good for what you get. The recorded audio explanations were sometimes hard to hear and could have been better. We would do it again or maybe try a different company or route.
Lovely walk. Walking by Herengratcht is a must do in Amsterdam. Its cafes and beautiful lights at night during summer months were unforgetable.
Great paintings. The Rembrandt collection is amazing, especiallly the Nightwatch.Also they have many other famous paintings, the Italian collectiion is lovely.
Walk or take a boat. A must-see if you're in Amsterdam. Lovely canal houses speak of the character and styles of Europe's middle class at the time when it was just emerging.

park your bike, cultural tour. best to park your bike here when visiting the Bible Museum, its' on this canal and there's a bike rack right outside. You can also bring a lunch and eat on the canal and then on your way.

Every bit as wonderful as the other inner-ring canals. I have spent a lot of time over the years walking along this canal and snapping photos of its houses and their gables. This is a place to bring not only your camera, but also your binoculars. Fabulous ornate mansions and canal houses line both sides. I can't recommend highly enough this wonderfully educational (architecturally and historically speaking) slice of Amsterdam's elegant past. Many buildings here were built before 1750, and some before 1700.
More gardens. we were lucky enough to meet some of the owners of these unique spaces and they were charming and welcoming and pleased to talk to visitors.

As beautiful as the other canals of the Grachtengordel. The Herengracht is, as any of the Amsterdam canals go - pretty! The oft-mentioned Golden Bend is a beautiful stretch to see but did not find that it stood out over other stretches of fine houses lining Prinsengracht and Keizersgracht, or even the smaller canals. One cannot go inside many of the listed historic buildings along Herengracht (eg., oldest house and Bartolotti house) and therefore these can only be appreciated from the outside for their architecture. As such, a boat cruise would suffice for this endeavour, although strolling along the canals is equally enjoyable with comfortable stops to be had in cafes or benches.

One of Three Major "Belt-way" Canals. See it!. Seeing the canals of Amsterdam is, to me, an essential part of a visit to the city. The Herengracht (Patricians' Canal or Gentlemen's Canal) is the second major ring canals, the first of the three major canals dug around the city centre in the 17th century. The other two are the Prinsengracht (Prince's Canal) and Keizersgracht (Emperor's canal). The canal is named after the heren regenders who governed the city in the 16th and 17th century. The most fashionable part is called the Golden Bend, with many double wide mansions, inner gardens and coach houses on Keizersgracht. If you travel around Amsterdam very much, it is hard to avoid encountering this large canal. It is a bit hard to tell one canal from the other, having a map and giving it a look before traveling the city is probably a good idea. This canal can be seen by various means, one of the canal boat tours may be the easiest.

Consider the Canal Museum. Apart from being the "smartest" canal in terms of buildings and a very nice walk or boat ride, the canal museum opened in 2012 is worth a visit. It's not very big, in a very well maintained building along the canal and an extremely well done multimedia experience. Good for a 45 minute to one hour visit.

Gentleman's canal. We visited both on foot and by boat, the trees, the lovely houses and the elegance. There are plenty of other similarly elegant canals and streets. A walking tour is the way to get to know them properly- with someone who has a good historical knowledge

Gorgeous homes along the canal. The buildings on this canal are among the most elegant in Amsterdam and well worth seeing. Our hotel was on this canal so we had the pleasure of following it almost every day of our five day stay. The mayor's house is there as are many other gorgeous homes.

nice canal. It was very beautiful. We walked the whole street to the Amstel river. There is one street where you can see all the bridges. We walked by it but saw it on the canal cruises. I took many pics of the buildings and canals!

Grachten-cruise to relax and explore. You are of course a tourist, you are not alone, but instead of a Touristbus-tour, you take a Grachten-cruise. You ship through the harbour and along the three most important and scenic Grachten. You see all kinds of houseboats, you cross some noisy "party-boats", you experience Amsterdam from an attractive and different ankle, you will see picturesque places to visit again afterwards by bike.And if you board your boat in the late afternoon (before sunset) with a small white wine and some snacks, it's a totally relaxing one-hour-cruise! Don''t miss it.
Central yet quiet. This is a great location,and my residence for the stay in Amsterdam.It's right on the 9 streets and central for all the attractions.
nice. Nice area, typical of Amsterdam and not very special one to be honest! I just enjoyed walking around ..
9 streets. Small boutique shops selling everything and anything cool. There are 9 streets of these small streets.definitely worth a stroll.

Best canal in Amsterdam. Our hotel, the Ambasade was on Herengracht. One might expect a street with access to restaurants and attractions might feel busy and hectic. Not so. Although we were within minutes of everything, it was so quiet and picturesque.
Beautiful canals. Take the "Hop on hop off" canal bus and see all the major canals. The view is different from the water.

Another beautiful canal. Herengracht is the first canal past the Singel canal, and like the Singel its full of beautiful townhouses, bridges, and typical quaint Dutch architecture. Far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Damrak and Dam square but still only a leisurely 10 minute walk from either. Also you'll find some nice cafes and places to grab a bite to eat. Definitely worth a stroll along the Herengracht on a nice afternoon or early evening, just remember to wrap up warm if its not in the summer months as the wind can get pretty chilly between the tall buildings either side of the canal.

Admiring architecture!. What a way to admire Amsterdam architecture! We first took the canal boat cruise to see the houseboats from the canal and then we walked to admire the surroundings at our own pace. Not to miss while in Amsterdam.

Central. Stayed here for three nights before travelling to Tilburg for a wedding. Can't remember the name of the hotel,but it was located on the Herengracht canal. The canal is very close to the centre and the railway station but far enough away for there to be no crowds or noise.Lovely canal for a leisurely walk. There are cafes and restaurants and the odd "coffee" shop.Would recommend
Canal Cruise. We passed through Herengracht on a night canal cruise and it was wonderful seeing the grand old houses along this canal.
Great place to walk. This canal is worth wandering along, preferably with a good guide book. We stayed around the corner and regularly walk along it to find, cafes, eateries and some funky galleries.

As beautifull as the rest of the center of the old Amsterdam.. A nice part of the "canals" area... :-) Close enough to the central station and to the very center of the city, plenty of nice restaurant around !
Beautiful and relaxing. Beautiful and relaxing canal with varieties of architetures and shops. One stop for walk, scene, food, drink and etc. Worth a visit.
Beautiful. I really recommend that everyone takes a trip on the canal.... It is beautiful and you really see what the city is all about

Great architecture. The canals are a world attraction and its well worth investing in a good guide book so you can more fully appreciate the history of this part of Amsterdam. Yes, you can just look at the facades but a few facts and pointers to interesting buildings add to its visual value.

One of the fluid trademarks of Amsterdam. If you walk from the Rembrandtplein to the the Utrechtsestraat, you will have a perfect start to experience the Amsterdam 'grachten' with their bridges. Many rich and famous Dutch artists,musicians and tc personalities own a house that is situated on a 'gracht', like this Herengracht.
A gorgeous canal from end to end. This canal has a lot to offer, from gorgeous views to places to shop and eat, as well as museums. It's worth walking end to end.
We saw it from our Hotelwindow.. One of the great sights in town. Lovely houses allong the gracht and plenty great bridges to explore its beauty

Great Canal walk. In my opinion:
Just as nice as the Prinsengraht.
But did not walk as long as I did on the Prinsengracht.
Walked to Haarlemstraat from the Herengraght from Rozengracht.
Loved the walk.
Beautiful and elegant. We stopped in a bed and breakfast (Sunhead of 1617) on the Herengracht and were witnesses to the canal boats and many bridges, all lit up at night. Great place to walk.

Good. Walking along the canals, its sometimes difficult to believe how close they are to the centre of Amsterdam. Strolling along the canals next to the beautiful houses is like walking in another world. Rather than just walking over the bridges to the next canal, make sure you take time to walk alongside the canals and take in the beautiful scenery..

Not so great on a winter evening. We took a boat tour of the Herengracht around 6pm in January. The tour was shortened compared to the brochure and was generally disappointing as there was not much to see after dark from the boat.

beautiful in all weathers. Both walking and boating along the Herrengracht is lovely. The architechture is just amazing. Such elegance! One can easily remember a time gone by when Amsterdam enjoyed a golden age. Walk all the way along the canal as far as the Westerkirk. Museums to visit en route. Windows to peep into. Art galleries. The 9 streets (an area of lovely boutiques and restaurants) All offers a visual feast

canels!. one of the most iconic peices of Amsterdam must be the Canels. The Herengracht is no exception on this rule. a beautiful piece of the city, and a joy to walk past the boats, and perfectly conserverd houses gives you an insighht in what the golden age of Amsterdam must be like.

Beautiful canal, nice place for a stroll. The Herengracht is a nice plce for an afternoon or evening stroll depending on the season. This canal is on the itinerary of most canal trips as it is one of the three major canals in Amsterdam. There a lot of typical Amsterdam homes and also good restaurants and hotels. There are also a couple of places which are interesting, an institute for gender equality and emancipation of women and a place where dedicated to cats. Good place for pictures and to enjoy the clean air.
Canals. amazing view, amazing canals!this street is lively and full of shops! I have loved everything I saw, especially the little and cute shops, together with bars and cafés

Beutiful canals :). We were lucky enough to pass here a lot since our friend lived there whilst our stay in Amsterdam. It is so close to Dam Square or the main Central Station (some 5-10 min walk) and offers a great view on the canals - just perfect for taking pictures by day or night :)

lovely canal with some striking architecture. We did one of the canal cruises and saw a bit of Herengracht, so we went back and walked the entire length. A good way to see a cross section of the canal ring and some beautiful buildings along the canal.

All those Grachts. If you like just to walk and see more and more of these unique houses, boats, boat houses, bridges and more and more little grachts - just walk along the Herengracht, or any of the other surrounding canals. Ice, broken ice, ducks, seagulls, swans and many beautiful views are all there. Lovely.
Beautiful area. Another beautiful area to walk through in Amsterdam. The canals are very helpful as a guide when trying to navigate the area. Watch out for bicycles, of course.

Pretty area. Walking along the canals, its sometimes difficult to believe how close they are to the centre of Amsterdam. Strolling along the canals next to the beautiful houses is like walking in another world. Rather than just walking over the bridges to the next canal, make sure you take time to walk alongside the canals and take in the beautiful scenery and quirky buildings.

Canal boat trip. There are various routes taken by the different Canal boat companies. The one I chose travelled along much of Herengracht. Lovely to see the old houses and hear something of their history.
What makes Amsterdam unique. The canals and tipical dutch houses are some of the architecture aspects what makes Amsterdam unique

Very romantic canal & central hotel. We centered our recent visit on this canal, staying in the excellent Banks Mansion. Please see my review there for details- They told us about the Canal Bus, it's a hop on hop off.. which has several stops on this canal. Also the Rembrantplein is close by with shops, bars & resturants. We walked this canal from end to end, with it's house boats, intresting gabled ended buildings & bridges.
Herengracht, prinsengracht, keizersgracht.... All canals are beautiful. It is worth the trip to Holland. I am grateful that I can always go to Amsterdam for a day.don't miss it!

lovely quiet area. we stayed at the Banks Mansion fabulous hotel in this area and couldn't have been happier. We had a choice of very regular trams to take us really close and Rembrants plein/ square around the corner for bars and resturaunts...what more could you ask for !! Would definately stay there again, best hotel I have ever stayed in !!
Beautiful canal. Nice views of the canal with XVII to XIX houses, take your time to enjoy it, nice to see with day light and in the evening
Quiet, Nice. I stayed along Herengracht for 3 nights. It's pretty quiet. Some canal tours came by, but little traffic and almost no tourists in the area we were in. Beautiful canal.

Beautiful. I stayed along here a few nights. It is stunning, there is everything you need within walking distance. It's worth seeing at night too, all the lights around the canals it looks beautiful. If you stay near here check out Spui, lots of good shops. Some stuff pretty cheap compared to Australia.

Brilliant. Loved everything - must see! Absolutely stunning and lots to see. The canals are beautiful and the boutique shops are great. Leads you to lots of little places you might have missed! Very stylish and quiet part of The Dam but also easily accessible to the main parts and dining areas

Beautiful canal. The architecture of the canal houses is brilliant; the boats tied up along the main "gracht" and the smaller ones feeding into it. Herengracht is elegant, and has terrific, well-curated shopping. Leisurely, lovely and worth walking along... heaven!

Nice quiet canal. Of the main canals in West Amsterdam, this is the quietest one. Don't miss 't Arendsnest for the best dutch beer selection in town. The Belgisch Restaurant Lieve next door has great food!

Canal boat rides were the way to go.. The boat captains were very kind and informative. Also when we came to a stop which we thought was going back to where we came we discovered that our stop was across the canal which entailed retracing out steps up the street across a bridge and then back down on the other side of the canal. It was POURING rain so the captain of the canal boat offered to take us across to the correct stop, which he did. He radioed the correct boat and they transferred us directly from boat to boat. They could not have been kinder or more helpful.

The spirit of Amsterdam. Actually, all the main canals, Hernegracht, Keizersgracht & Prinsengracht are beatiful. Walk anticlockwise from the station end. Cross and re-cross the bridges and wind around, look up to the gabled ends of the buildings. This is Amsterdam at its best. You will find fine houses, strange houseboats, beautiful churches, cats on doorsteps, small cafes, but few shops. Watch out for bicycles - they don't like pedestrians.
Herengracht vistas. Simply a lovely area to wander and view the canals and bridges and of course the bike riders galore.
Great for rainy day. 100 sites of Amsterdam leaves from in front of Centraal Station. Worthwhile trip on a comfortable boat.
Nice bridge. It's really a nice place and area in Amsterdam. It's romantic and very nice during the evening. it's a must -do during your trip in Amsterdam.
thats great. during I'm visit, there was has rainbow.... :)It was wonderfull..I go there with my collegue. hopely i can saw the rainbow again..
Another sterling canal. Located along the same parallel lines as the Prinsengracht, this is another canal [gracht] that rings the centrum of the sity.
Beautiful area with historical houses. I recommend to find a hotel by that canal! It situates both near the central area and gives you the peace you 'd need while visiting big cities.

Gentleman's Canal. They say it is the noblest canal with its towering houses. I also enjoyed the Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht. We took the canal bus for a city ride, which was wonderful. Also we took a Candlelight Cruise through Amsterdam, the canals and gable houses look fantastic in the dark!

Very nice canal. We found the western area of the "Gentlemen's Canal" very lovely and enjoyed exploring the areas especially closer to the Dam. After a while, all the canals begin looking alike so hit it early in your trip. If you attend the ANne Frank House attraction, walk to the Dam across all three central canals for a nice comparison and contrast.
The 3rd one. You really do need to go along these canals, either on foot or in a boat to appreciate the layout of the city and it's history
Strolling Amsterdam. As with Prisengracht, the homes are lovely, the architecture is delightful and the calm walks are wonderful.

Canal Boat Could have been better.. I would have picked a tour with a more interactive guide. The guy driving our canal boat never said a word, just played the canned tape; I feel that he could have added some interesting tips, had he wanted. Needless to say, he did not get a tip from us. We paid way too much money for 1 hour trip. Otherwise, the Herengracht is a gorgeous canal and worth riding around to see the city and the homes. I would have preferred an open boat, not one of the glass topped low canal boats.

Canal...... ....Boat tour is the best way to see all the canals and get your bearings in the city but, once you've done that, walk, walk and walk some more..., if your feet can cope you will run into some amazing sight, people and pubs...:-)
Charm of the City. Like the other such as Prinsengracht, a unique canal. The canals are a large part of the charm of the city!

The Lord's Canal. Being one of the three major canals in Amsterdam, Herengracht is a residential area housing beautiful double wide mansions. You can discover Herengracht by canal cruise tours, but my advice is to also to wander around.

go a long the main shopping street and you will find it. its one ofthe streets crossing there are some nice cafe and restaurants on it nad its one of those streets with a canal . gracht means canal. part of the nine streets you can walk along this one almost from one end to the other of the city
Really beautiful canal. The history Amsterdam lives in its canals - do not miss this one. Take a boat or take a walk but go see it. We loved it!
Magnificent Canal and History. The Canal Cruise traveled the Herengracht from end to end. The history is fascinating. It is clear that life on the Canal is the center of Amsterdam culture.
superb area. the very heart of Amsterdam. Superb houses ; I like the quietness of the area, the homogeneity as well

Simply beautiful.. Take a moment or two to walk along the waterside, see the many old houses there, enjoy the view along the gracht, sit down for a coffee ... Herengracht is a splendid location and will give you some grand Amsterdam feeling.
Very posh canal. Take a boat or walk down this canal. It is rather posh and there are some lovely houses. The blue line on the canal cruise takes you down there.

"When does this place close?". No, this place doesn't close, this is an actual residential area and not a sight built for tourists, as this particularly ignorant American thought. It's authentic and beautiful and well-worth a visit - either by way of a canal boat or a lovely stroll.
All canals are beautiful in summer. Amsterdam is fantastic in summer, and 96 % of the reason is the canals. Take a stroll and get lost in the labyrinth of canals and winding streets.
Beautiful canal. All the canals are beautiful and fascinating. This is one of the major ones with lovely canal homes and fascinating boats going to and fro. Many flowers everywhere.
Another delightful canalside walk. A pleasant contrast to the hustle and bustle of Damrak or the seedier East side of the city. Ideal for an evening stroll.
Best of the canals. This canal boasts some of the most beautiful of the old city homes. It worth exploring via boat or foot.

most gorgeous canal. the hearth of classic Amsterdam with most beautiful buildingsand two completely different museum - the Biblical and the Kattencabinet - a museum of cats. Very enjoyable canal just for walking around and have a beer or coffee with an unforgettable view

Canal Trip. The Herengracht is part of the over-all canal trip, again interesting in Amsterdam's history as it represents kind of a bourgeois pinnacle of achievement, or as an interesting book about Holland once put it "embarrassment of riches" that the country achieved during its peak mercantile endeavors

Are you in Amsterdam? Are you going to the canals? Make sure this is part of it!. With each canal presenting a different view on the city, and the rich tapestry of history woven in to every street, every canal passing, be sure to have a good guide.
staying in amsterdam. great area to stay in safe / great shopping and reastaurants and cafes and close to everything.
Boat trip view. This canal is lined with beautiful luxury houses, a boat trip here is a must.
Lovely. Stroll and enjoy. Have to see at day time and at night. Enjoy!
beautiful canal. lovely canal lined with cafes - great for people watching
Stroll and enjoy!. Little boutiques and shops. Private homes and churches.
Very nice!. Another good stretch of the water....great for wandering around....

A true gem. The houses along the canals are true gems to see.
Unfortunately AMS is not always clean, so trash is floating in the canals or on the strrets.
Beautiful Walk. This is probably the most beautiful canal in Amsterdam. Lots of 16th and 17th century canal houses. A stroll here as the sun is setting is spectacular.

Great Bar on Canal at Leidseplein & Herrengracht. Great hang-out spot right on the canal, for lunch or dinner or in between. Mix of locals and tourists, we spent over an hour here, met a neat lady college instructor.
Being on the canal is wonderful seeing the tour boats and other little canal boats going back and forth.
One of the most beautiful canals. This canal definitely shows off its good looks. The architecture along this canal is stunning and it is peppered with little shops, galleries and restaurants.
Upscale Houses. It was along the Herengracht that the wealthy merchants chose to live. So there are many houses that are upscale and are well cared for. There are also many stores and restaurants.
A Beautiful Canal. This canal combines residential and commercial properties. Wear a good pair of walking shoes and enjoy Amsterdam.
"Gentlemen's canal". This canal is lined by beautiful, old and some new homes. Very lovely and relaxing.
Walk The Canals. Gracht means canal - this, and the other canals that define old Amsterdam are beautiful. They are all walkable and are a core part of the charm of this wonderful city.
Nice canal. Similar to other canals. If its a nice day, put on your running shoes and run around this canal.
Another great canal. There are loads of canals in Amsterdam - this is one of my top 3 - lots to see and do and plenty of places for a nice coffee and sit down.

one of the famous canals in the old district. Together with the Prinsengracht and the Keizersgracht one of the loveliest places in the old town to walk through. , Magnificent views on the water, beautiful houses, some interesting shops too, especially in the neighbourhood of the 'Negen straatjes' district. A very peaceful & cosy atmosphere.
great house fronts. I loved strolling along this canal and visiting museums as the house interiors are something to see as are the gardens in the back.

Canal street going through central Amsterdam. Major thoroughfare in Amsterdam. Cobbled streets line either side. You can walk or rent a bike and go the entire length of the canal. Amsterdam is so small a city, you just walk the streets, stopping to see a historic sight or shop or grab a snack. Perfect city break

Great for a walk on a sunny day. Buildings, bars, cafes, restaurants.
The canal curves between the two main shopping streets. And if you are tired you can always hop on a tram
Beaytiful architecture and cosy cafes to pop into. Seeing Amsterdam on foot and wandering these canals is a must...just watch out for the cyclsts!

Very nice walk. Herengracht canal is one of Amsterdam canals, very quite neighboudhood. You cam walk all along the canal, see the house boats, the buildings, people riding bikes, you ll never forget it!
Boho. Twisty narrow streets, crammed town houses, unique shops and cafes. Great vibe and lovely to meander around the area.
Great little shops and cycle heaven. Try 309 Herengracht for a cosy hot chocolate, watch the cyclists try to find a bike parking spot.

Peaceful. Such a lovely neighbourhood. Came to the Herengracht to find the Handbag museum and Cat Cabinet and such the neighbourhood so beautiful, it's really worth taking a stroll if you have spare time in the city.

Best Orientation. Boat tour was the best orientation to learn about Amsterdam and I enjoyed this more than the one in Venice.It was very relaxed on the boat watching the beautiful houses dating back to the 16th-17th centuries, the lined old trees, the historical landmarks, the carillon churches, the charming bridges, the busy city cyclists, markets…The lord’s canal (Herengracht), the first of the three major canals in the city was one of the most popular spot and it was quite scenic to pass the so called “Golden Bend”, where the elegant Dutch mansions of the wealthy people were located.

Just stroll and look out for bicycles. OK, so you did the canal tour and, chances are, had no idea where you were after 5 minutes. If you want to enjoy this great canal, stroll along it, stand on its bridges and just keep looking. I like to cross back and forth; there are always details on the buildings that catch your eye from a new angle, and every view from the bridges is worth pausing for.
Beautiful. I love walking here... it is a typical AMS street.
Peaceful. Lovely to wander along, looking at the houses and stopping in the canal side bars and coffee shops.
Most picturesque area in the city. The neighborhood is full of early 17th century houses along the canals. Very few cars, good restaurants and boutiques.
High on My List. A lot of interesting, well maintained houses on this canal.
We stayed on the Herengracht. A vibrant part of the city - full of life and colour

Great Walking area. Our bed and breakfast was on this street - -close to just about everything ..within easy walks! just watch out for the bicycles..That would go for all over the city. You have to get used to what are the bike paths and where you can walk
Nice area. This is a nice area to stay in close to Prinsegracht
Canal. Old canal street in the historical area, nice to walk
Herengracht. This feels like a little bit of a different, more gentle time than the bustling city all around.

Very picturesque canal. Like the other canals, this one is beautiful and very picturesque on a fine day. Lovely walking along the canal, just need to watch out for the bicycles as they come whizzing past.

Great to watch from a boat ride.. During the boat ride in the Amsterdam canals, you can watch the Herengract's houses and it is amazing. Really worth taking the ride just to watch them from the canal.

The Gentlemens Canal. This is the second most important and largest of three canals that semi circum vent the whole city, along with over 700 adjoining canals and more than 1200 bridges crossing those canals, it all makes for a very exciting and marvelous place to explore.
This canal has some beautiful examples of grand Amsterdam canal stately homes.
Lovely. The old houses and people skating on the ice, on the canal, what more do you want...
Food and drinks is great. Food is decent, but both food and drinks are on the expensive side. However I will probably not go back as there was smoking downstairs and the service was slow.
Hours of aimless wandering. Spend plenty of time walking up and down Herengracht and the other Grachts - you will never be short of places to see / visit / eat / drink / shop!
skatetastic!. This canal was the big draw over our weekend. It was frozen solid and was the centre of a whole day of races - televised races at that!
A lovely walk. This was a very nice walk along the canal, albeit frozen, to view the wonderful architecture.

Excellent view in winter. The canal is actually same as the others; but every canal has its own beauty. When I was there, the canal was almost frozen like the others.
Herengracht is an amazing place to take a stroll and to take many great pictures.
Street of the Times Hotel! Very nice canal street!. Very nice canal street, very close to the nine streets, the centraal station and many DAM square.
A standard canal.... Obviously a beautiful city, but this canal is the same as the others... We did a canal cruise, and we didn't see anything you can't see walking around the city..

Typisch Amsterdamse. We stayed at the Rembrandt Classic Hotel, which looks over Herengracht. It's a very beautiful backwater within minutes of Dam & ever so quiet. Beautiful old Dutch architecture with buidings several storeys high. Was confused by one, whch had the name Cornwall painted on it just below the roof...
Beautiful canal. Here you can see the wealth of the past and the wealth of today. Although a lot of houses are commercial buildings nowadays.

Love Amsterdam!. The Herengracht is amazing; if you love water and canals. I find this to be a peaceful atmosphere (meaning anything around the water). This is a great place to take a stroll, ride a bike, sit and read a book or just hang out and take pictures. If you have the opportunity take a boat tour which sails along the Herengracht so you get a better picture of this fantastic city called Amsterdam!
Class. This is a really classy area, stroll and submerge yourself in luxury.
Beautiful dutch buildings.. So wonderful to walk the canal which hasnt really changed for centuries
one of some canal rings. it's good to walk or to travel with a boat. Some good galleries and plenty of bikes and cars!!!
by boat. is the best way to see these houses. the all tell a story. bikes, people, dogs are everywhere and that makes this street.

fantastic. We were blessed with a gorgeous, dry sunny day in Mid January. My partner couldn't stop taking photos. This area is every bit as enjoyable as the more formal places to see in Amsterdam. Relax, stroll, enjoy!

good place to stroll. This street is at the centre of amsterdam life. It is a wonderful place for a romantic stroll with lots of little streets and shops to investigate. The buildings are magnificent but if you wish to get the most out of an architectural visit, I suggest that you take the green line canal taxi to get a brief commentary and a leisurely look at the magnificent opulent town houses.
Magnificent architecture. A great canal to stroll along and see the magnificent canal houses built for the rich Dutch merchants in the 17th century.
Nice Views. Really pretty section of the city. Nice area to walk around in and stop by a cafe. The boat tour of this area is a great way to see it.
Most elegant canal. Here is where the Rich lived and traded. Now large parts of it are office buildings. But still it breaths chique.....
nice and cosy. nice and cosy place, a little away from the big crowd. nice stroke to walk, drink a coffee and do some art shopping
Classic Dutch architecture. Just beautiful buildings - with the odd bar and restaurant to slow your journey down.
Stunning. Did the canal trip which takes in the Herrengracht. Stunning views and very atmospheric.
Canals and big houses, great trip by boat!.. What can i say, beautiful setting, old big houses and the water...
Worth A Visit. An old historical part of the city with interesting houses and canals.

Pretty street away from busy town, nice for a walk. There is thre Gracht (Canal) in the middle, very pretty with all the houseboats, cyclists, little wonky street and typical old dutch houses. This is one of the oldest street in Amsterdam and the upper class was used to live here. It still looks like that.
Very nice walk.. I understand this is a very prestigious street. We enjoyed looking at the buildings. I think this was on the route of the canal cruise we took.

very nice canal houses. I took a boat trip which took me past a part of the Herengracht, along with the other canals, this is Amsterdam, this is what makes the city different from any other city in the world... very beautiful houses indeed!.
A must. Beautiful and well worth a visit. Take a night-time boat trip if you can
